column1: nice and full, slanting in at off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length and angling into the pads, duly picked off to fine leg
pitched up and swings away late outside off, Sibley presses forward and watches it through to the keeper
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, ignored once again by Sibley
much fuller and Ishant brings this back in at off from wide of the crease, Sibley covers the line and defends it to the leg side
darted on off at 135ks, full again, Sibley jabs the ball down to mid-on

Pant throws himself to his right and drops a low chance. Full and slanting down the leg side, Burns shuffles a long way across, aims to glance it away, does not get enough bat on ball, and ultimately gets away. Pant dives and can only tip it away
wide of the crease, there's Bumrah's exaggerated incoming angle, but doesn't threaten off, so Sibley lets it go
on a length and curves back in from outside off, Sibley plants his front foot across and shoulders arms
on a length and nips back in from outside off once again, no shot from Sibley again
very full at off, 134ks, Sibley stretches out and jams it back to the bowler
Bumrah cranks it up to 141ks, brings another one back into the right-hander, blocked to the leg side
back of a length and swerves back in from around the wicket, ignored
on a length and aiming for the top of off, 137ks, Burns' forward-defensive intervenes
Burns has this tendency to shuffles across his stumps, the left-hander gets inside the line of this length ball and flicks it neatly through midwicket. Washington, I think, chases the ball down
nice and full outside off, no real movement in the air or off the pitch, Sibley shoulders arms
full and on a fourth-stump line outside off, Sibley inches forward and defensively guides the ball towards point
Sibley gets off the mark off his 12th ball with a push to the left of Ashwin at short cover
tip and run in front of point. They take on Nadeem's arm for a single. Back of a length and outside off, guided square on the off side
full and slanting in from outside off, 133.3ks, Burns lets it pass
back of a length and skidding in at off, 141.2ks, Burns jams back and jabs the ball away through square leg
dug in shorter and angling in at off, nearly 140ks, Burns goes deeper in the crease and blunts it to the leg side
on a length and seams back in from outside off, no shot once again
back of a length and sailing over fourth stump as Burns lets it go through to Pant
very full and slanting in at off, played back to the bowler
Sibley tips forward and taps this incoming full ball to the right of Pujara, towards short midwicket
good length and holds its line outside off, Sibley swishes his bat away from the line and lets it pass
mighty full and dips at off stump, possibly a slower variation from Ishant. Patted to the covers. And Ishant has overstepped
back of a length and angling in at middle, Sibley shuffles across and defensively works the ball away to short midwicket
much fuller and angling in from outside off, Sibley judges it well and leaves it be

ripper from Ishant! On a length, angling in towards off, then straightens away late past the outside edge. Sibley did well not to push out at that. He tucks his bat inside the line and allows himself to get beaten
on a length and angling in at he top of off, blocked to the leg side
Bumrah tests Burns with a lifter, he ducks under it
Burns shuffles forward and across to defend this length ball on off back to Bumrah
back of a length and angling in, Burns, having jumped across off, flicks it to Nadeem at square leg
full and angling in at off, Burns presses forward and closes his bat-face, jabbing this full-toss towards mid-on
back of a length and angling in, Burns keeps it out and closes out the over
short and slanting in at off stump, Sibley gets right behind the line in defence
good length and on a fourth-stump line, Sibley opens the face and runs it to cover
full on the stumps, forward and whisked away to midwicket
full and holds its line outside off, Sibely doesn't quite meet the pitch. He is happy to sit back, close his bat-face, and jab it away to short midwicket
pitched up and holds its line outside off, dies on its way to Pant, as Sibley shoulders arms
full and angling in at off, played back down the pitch
good length, the new ball slides in, knocked away wide of short leg
turn for Ashwin with the new ball. Short, and spins back in from outside off, allows Burns to step back. He jabs it away off an outside edge past slip. Ashwin won't mind this
on a length and sliding in this time, blocked wide of short leg again
tossed up on off, quicker at 91ks, played back towards Ashwin
much shorter and breaking in at middle, Sibely jumps back and punches it away through the legs of Gill, I think, at short leg
full, slides in with the arm or just the natural variation, Burns sits back and defensively works it to short leg
Ishant continues to target the stumps, full on off, Sibley inches forward and dabs the ball up to cover
nice and full, attacking middle now, but Sibely covers up in defence
back of a length and around off, blunted into the covers
bumper, nearly 140ks, Sibley has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
too full on middle, allowing Sibley to tuck it away through backward square leg
a bit of hesitation between the wickets, but a misfield at square leg helps England's cause. On a length, slanting in, Burns picks it off, and eventually collects a single
pushed through and dips at off, Burns gets forward and dead-bats it away
fired into the pads, 96ks, Burns picks it off through midwicket this time
looped up and just a shade outside off, defended
quicker and sliding in on middle, defended back
some turn and bounce for Ashwin but it finishes outside off, left alone by Burns
pushed through, skidding in on middle, defended back
full and holds its line outside off, Sibley has a crack at it, but does so with soft hands. Plus no pace in the pitch. The ball does not carry, with Sibley threading the cordon
on a length and angling down leg, at 140.1ks, Burns jumps a long way across once again, like he did off Bumrah's first ball, but does not touch it this time

pitched up and outside off, Burns tips it to Nadeem at short cover, and aims a risky single, but Sibley asks him to undo his steps. Nadeem swoops down on the ball, but misses a direct hit, and ends up conceding an overthrow. England get the single they wanted

full and veering into the pads, flicked away through square leg. More work for Nadeem, this time in the outfield. He runs across to his left, steps on the ball, but no harm done. He has saved one run for his side
short and slanting in from outside off, Burns shoulders arms
on a length and outside off, Burns opens the face and tickles it to gully with soft hands
tossed on off, Sibley stretches out to smother any spin
Sibley goes forward and across to defend this with the break to the right of forward short leg
Ashwin dangles this up on off stump, dead-batted away
full and on off, forward and defensively worked away to short midwicket
pushed through faster and flatter, 91ks, defended to short leg on the bounce
tossed up slower, fuller, spins and dips, Sibley does not meet the pitch. He eyes up the leg side, but ends up chipping a leading edge towards cover
fullish, angling into middle and leg, clipped to the deepish midwicket fielder
fullish, angling across to off stump, defended back down the pitch
length ball slanting across the left-hander, not too far outside off at the finish, but a good leave, trusting Bumrah's angle

ooh, good ball. A little fuller and straighter, and Burns doesn't get a stride in to drive. Bat comes down at an angle from gully towards mid-on, and he gets a thick outside edge that runs away to the left of backward point
full, angling into off stump, defended into the covers
length ball on off stump, and that's nicely done. A gentle defensive push past the stumps at the other end, and they quickly steal one to mid-on, who has to run in a fair distance and to his left
tossed up, spinning in from just outside off, gets forward and clips towards midwicket
full again, straighter line, clipped away from middle-and-leg and finds the gap to the left of square leg. Nice timing too. Right into the gap between forward square leg and short midwicket
a touch short, keeps going with the arm outside off. Goes back and across to defend into the on side
fuller now, clipped to midwicket
quickish, on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
tossed up slower, spins in from outside off, stretches out to block into the on side
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to short midwicket
back of a length, rising up to chest height around middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and blocks into the leg side
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and defends with soft hands towards gully. That bounced quite steeply to hit the sticker of Burns' bat
length ball, worked away from a middle-and-off line towards long leg
length ball angling into off stump, presses forward and clips through backward square leg

ooh, looks for the yorker, slips in a 138kph low full-toss on middle stump from around the wicket, and Burns' bat comes down at that angle again, slicing across the line towards wide mid-on. Ends up squirting it into the covers off the outside edge
and now he zips one past Sibley's edge. Back of a length in the fourth-stump channel, and he gets it to straighten slightly to beat Sibley's defensive push
flat, fairly full and angling into middle stump, defended into the on side
steps out now, gets close to the pitch of this middle-and-off ball and drives with a straight bat to the left of mid-on
length ball close to off stump, not a whole lot of turn, blocked back towards the bowler
tossed up slower on off stump, and Sibley plays around his front pad to clip to short leg
similar line and length, but this one doesn't turn. Just goes on straight towards off stump, and he's nicely behind it to defend
tossed up a bit fuller on off stump, clipped to short leg
goes back to this length ball turning in from outside off, blocks to short leg
first sweep of the day? Fairly flat, and on the shorter side for a sweep. Plays it well enough, sweeping from outside off to the left of deep backward square leg
Nicely bowled. Flight and dip, and he's not close enough to the pitch to defend, goes with the arm to hit the inside edge into front boot
a touch shorter, punched firmly to cover point
tossed up slow, gets a big stretch out to defend just in front of his pad, with soft hands
a touch short, a touch wide, and Sibley rocks back to cut it away to the right of backward point
nice length outside off, quite quick, hurried into a forward defensive into the covers
this one's angled in from a little wider, towards off stump, and Burns is forward to block
now Ashwin drops slightly short, and he rocks back to chop it away fine of backward point
full on middle and leg, clipped watchfully to short leg
nicely bowled, similar line but the length isn't quite as full. Gets forward and blocks to short leg
and again, probes away on that middle-and-leg line. A bit quicker, and Sibley defends to short midwicket, with bat having to come around his pad slightly
sees Burns looking to step out and fires a quick one at the pads, clipped away to long leg
tossed up, angling into off stump from wide of the crease. Plays a little inside-out to block into the covers
turn and bounce, leaves this length ball alone outside off
fuller now, on middle and leg, defended with soft hands, and it doesn't turn as much as expected. Off the inside half of the bat into the leg side
flatter, goes back to punch into the covers
tossed up slow on off stump, presses forward and blocks it back to Nadeem
tossed up slow and full outside off, blocked back to the bowler
down the track and Ashwin angles this one into middle and leg to deny him room. Clipped to midwicket
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped around the corner to deep backward square leg, brings up England's 50. These two have batted very well so far
length ball angling into off stump, not  a lot of turn, defended back to Ashwin
tossed up slow, just outside off, presses forward and blocks with soft hands
fuller, off-stumpish line, defended off the front foot, and short extra-cover jogs in to pick up the ball
tossed up on off stump, big stretch forward to defend
back of a length on off stump, goes back to punch into the on side
flighted ball outside off, a bit of turn and bounce, good stretch out to block into the cover point region
stays back to a fairly full one on off stump, defends back towards the bowler
length ball on off stump, goes back and clips to short midwicket
flatter, on leg stump, gets forward to clip through backward square leg
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
ooh, that was on the air. Fullish on leg stump, and Sibley flicks in the air to the right of the fielder at leg gully
tossed up on off stump, gets forward to push into the covers

ooh, dangerous. That ball is pitching on off stump and sliding on with the angle, mostly. Gets a big stride across to sweep, exposing all his stumps, and manages to get just enough bat on it to hit it fine
flat length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
quicker, goes on the back foot to clip to midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, gets forward to clip into the square-leg region
full, angling down leg, gets forward and plays around his front leg to clip to backward square leg
quickish length ball on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
flat length ball just outside off, defended into the cover point region
length ball on middle stump, defended into the on side
tossed up full outside off, driven to extra-cover
length ball slides on towards off stump, defended to silly point
tossed up on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shot! Jumps out of his crease and gets close to the pitch of this off-stump ball, drives with a straight bat wide of mid-on
flat length ball spinning towards off stump, goes back and defends solidly
tossed up, angling across the left-hander, defended into the covers
a bit more flight, pitching outside leg and turning into the stumps, defended into the on side

what have you done, Rory Burns? Fourth ball from over the wicket, and Burns looks to take on the reverse-sweep off a length ball on the stumps. Through his shot too eagerly and too early, and the ball lobs up off his gloves for the simplest of catches to Pant
quickish length ball turning in from just outside off, defended back to the bowler
angled into that middle-and-leg line from around the wicket again, big stretch forward to defend into the on side
a bit quicker on middle stump, gets his front pad out of the way to block this
length ball angling into middle and leg from wide of the crease, defended into the on side
tossed up slow, pitches on middle-stump. Big stretch forward to block into the on side
now he gets one to dip and spin away from off stump. Sibley is on the front foot, defends with soft hands so the edge drops safely wide of slip
a bit fuller on middle and off, gets forward to defend into the on side
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to block it back towards the bowler
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler

one brings two, and Bumrah has sent Lawrence back with a beauty! He had defended the last two balls from the crease, with no real forward stride, and a similar crease-bound response is of no use against this ball, which is a little fuller and tails in sharply, late. Not sure if it's reverse-swing or movement off the seam, but he was an absolute sitting duck, playing hurriedly across the line and missing. He thought of a review, but decided against it. Struck him on the back pad, and ball-tracking says it would have hit middle stump
back of a length outside off, and he's away in typically busy fashion, opening his bat face and steering wide of gully
length ball straightens a touch towards off stump, defended into the on side

tossed up outside off, gets a bit of away-drift, and that provokes a lazy drive from Root. No turn, and Root, looking to use his wrists and work it leg side, gets a leading edge that goes into the covers, in the air, but into a gap
tossed up on off stump, stretches out to block it back to the bowler
flat length ball outside off, hurried into a shuffling back-foot defensive

flat length ball on off stump, goes back to work it towards square leg, and they take  on the single despite the ball going towards the fielder's throwing hand. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end... Oh, it might not be a direct hit. Seems to hit Ashwin's hand, which then hits the stumps, but Root is home anyway. What a tight single, though, and at what a time.
full on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
tossed up slow on middle and leg, big stretch out to block it back
full and outside off, 137ks, holds its line, Root shows restraint in shouldering arms
back of a length and swerves in at off, jabbed into the covers
pitched up and homing away outside off, Root shoulders arms
good length and angling into a forward-defensive to mid-on on off
on a length and angling into off stump, Bumrah often creates a sharp angle, Root ventures forward and across to block it to the left of short midwicket
fullish and outside off, run away between covers and point
looped up at off stump, Root deploys a short stride and defends
pushed through on off, dead-batted away
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, Root hangs back and glides it through point
Ashwin holds this one back, much fuller and outside off, Root delays his drive, and pushes it up to extra-cover
floated up and spins in at off, defended to short leg
pushed through on middle and leg, blocked to short midwicket
short and angling in at off, defended back
much fuller and skidding in at off, Root gets right behind the line and taps it to cover
near-yorker length, delivery, swerving in at off stump, jammed through to square leg
full and on a fourth-fifth stump line outside off, Root feels for it, but does so with soft hands, dabbing it to gully
on a length and around the same line, Root opens the face and dinks it gully once again
bumper from wide of the crease, Root is happy to duck under it. Flies through to Pant down the leg side, wide called. Okay, Bumrah has overstepped once again
nice and full, slanting in towards middle, forward and bunted to mid-on
tossed and dips at off, Sibey goes forward and across to defend it to short leg
flatter and quicker outside off, forward and clipped to midwicket, where the fielder lets it through him
dangled up on middle, some spin, of the slower variety, defended to the leg side
floated up outside off, Ashwin keeps it full, defended on off stump
pushed through and spins in at off and middle, Sibey goes forward and across in defence again
tossed outside off, drags Sibley forward into a open-faced push into the covers
back of a length and slanting in at off, Root camps back and glances it through the vacant spaces through square leg
back of a length and darted in on middle, blocked to short midwicket
Bumrah attacks the stumps with enough protection on the leg side. Turned to short midwicket
full and homing in at off stump, Root presses forward and defends stoutly
Packed leg-side field? Root still finds a gap. Too full and straight, hangs back and flicks it sweetly to the right of midwicket this time
Sibley clips this incoming ball to the man at square-ish midwicket
tossed up full on off, defends from the crease
pushed through faster, seems to drift away outside off, Root feels for it and is beaten outside edge
Root dares to step out to Ashwin, but is beaten in flight, as Ashwin draws a leading edge to cover. He's threatening all edges
pushed through on off, defended
slid through on off, nearly 95ks, defended off the back foot
on a length and spins in at the top of off, Root covers up and plays it back to the bowler
back of a length and slanting in at middle, blocked to Kohli at short mid-on
shorter and sliding into the stumps once again, forced off the back foot to short midwicket
Sibley rides the bounce of this short delivery outside off and glides it to gully
on a length and angling in at off, Sibley gets forward and across to defend this to silly mid-on
full and angling into middle, clipped to Gill at deep midwicket
on a length and slanting in, left alone outside off
absolute beauty from around the wicket. Perfect length, angling across and bringing Sibley forward to defend. Just keeps going with the angle to beat his outside edge
shorter, spinning down leg, left alone
flatter, angling across, looks to cut and he's beaten by the extra pace
full on middle and leg, defended into the on side
down the track now and he can't reach the pitch of this. Dips and turns just a touch as he looks to flick, and it's off the inside half of the bat and runs away to the right of short leg
tossed up, spinning in from off stump, stretches out to defend into the on side
back of a length and angling into the hips, worked away through square leg for one
Oooh, Root nearly chops it on. Short and outside off, Root goes across off, throws his bat at ball and inside-edges it past off stump
short and slanting into middle, bunted to short midwicket
much fuller and reverses, drawing Root into a leg-side flick. Off the pad and rolls to the left of Pant
on a length and holds its line outside off, as opposed to tailing in, run away towards point

Ishant pings Root's pad, but this isn't threatening the stumps. On a length, Ishant gets this to sharply swerve back into Root, he plays around his front pad, and falls over. But this seems to be heading down leg
full and outside off, Root confidently presses forward and pushes it to mid-off
on a length on middle, defended
pushed through on off and straightens, blocked to midwicket
pushed through at the stumps, defended to short leg
Ashwin probes away on middle and leg, chipped in the air, but does not carry to Washington at midwicket
tossed up, full on off, dead-batted away

looped up on middle, Sibley nervously ventures down the track, does not get close enough to the pitch. Chipped in the air again but doesn't carry to Kohli at silly mid-on or Washington at short midwicket
back of a length and sliding in at off, Root covers up in defence
does not carry to Rohit at first slip. Good length and homing away outside off, Root feels for it, does so with soft hands, ensuring it doesn't carry to Rohit
on a length and Ishant seemingly gets reverse once again, blocked to short midwicket
on a length and tails in at off, poked towards square leg
looks like a slower-ball legcutter from Ishant, barely 120ks, Root checks his push and defends close to his body
very full and aimed at off, Root whips only as far as short midwicket. Ishant and Ashwin continue to probe away in tamdem
on a length and breaks in at middle, played back to the bowler
dangled up outside off, Sibley was itching to take on Ashwin. He lunges forward, and drives it away to the right of mid-on. Sweet as. Little risk this time
Ashwin gives this more air, picked off to midwicket
pitches around middle and breaks down the leg side, 78ks, no shot
Ashwin flicks out a carrom ball, Sibley tips forward and plays it back to the bowler
Ashwin targets the leg stump, pushed back to the right of Ashwin
full and drifts in towards off stump, Root inches forward to defend
dragged shorter and spins away just outside off, allowing Root to jump back and chop to covers
shorter and skidding down the leg side, beats the glance, the ball bounces pops out of Pant's gloves
Root leans back and punches to cover
pushed through on middle and leg, worked to square leg
shorter and outside off again, not much turn for Nadeem, Root leans back and jabs wide of silly point, into the cover-point region
fired on middle, 89ks, defended to the leg side
much quicker, 95ks, a bit too full and outside off, Root stretches out, meets the pitch and drives handsomely past Ashwin at cover
shorter and faster on off, defended back
danged up on off stump, Root stretches out to smother any spin
this is too full for the sweep, Root still dares to go for that shot. This is his first sweep on the tour. Ends up stabbing the ball away behind square on the leg side
picked away to midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, gets a big stride forward to defend
length ball angling towards off stump, not much turn, defended from the forward press
fuller, on off stump, blocked towards short extra-cover
shot. This is one of the reasons why Root is so good against spin. Not particularly short, but he goes right back onto his stumps and opens his bat face to dab it wide of slip
length ball angling into off stump, defended into the on side. Didn't turn as much as he expected, and went off the inside half of the bat
a bit fuller, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
full on middle and off, gets his front pad out of the way to defend square on the off side
down the track to the middle-and-leg ball, clipped towards midwicket
floated across to off stump, big stretch forward to block into the covers
shot. Second reverse-sweep of the day, but he executed this so well. Flat, angling across, pitching around about leg stump. Reads the length perfectly and puts it away fine of backward point
length ball on leg stump, clipped to short leg
leg-stumpish, quite full, closes his bat face early while looking to flick and the leading edge rolls into the covers
nicely flighted on off stump, good stretch out to defend into the on side
flatter now, on off stump, stays back to block it down into the pitch
shot. Sees a bit of flight on this middle-and-leg ball and jumps out, meets it right next to the pitch of the ball, and clips it crisply, wide of mid-on
tossed up outside off, stretches out and defends with soft hands
flat length ball angling into middle and leg, goes back and clips to short leg
tossed up slow, close to off stump, and the ball stops off the pitch a little. Waits and blocks into the covers
flat, angling across to off stump, goes right back to clip to short leg, who's standing fairly deep
a little straighter, and he tucks it away to long leg
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
tossed up a bit slower, just outside leg, clipped through square leg
tossed up outside leg, swept away to long leg
flat and quick outside leg, left alone, and extra bounce causes Pant to fumble
back of a length on off stump, goes right back to punch into the point region
tossed up on milddle and off, stretches out to block into the on side
full on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
flat, close to off stump, a touch short. Goes back and defends
now he gives it some air, on an off-stumpish line, jumps out and smothers it nicely
wide of the crease, angles a flighted ball in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover
tossed up on leg stump, and there's the reverse-sweep again. This time backward point is a little finer, so he can move quickly to his left and stop the ball
full on leg stump, gets a big stride forward to clip to midwicket
well bowled. Pulls his pace and length back slightly, and Sibley, looking to clip to midwicket off the front foot, sends a leading edge running away to backward point
fullish on middle and leg, defended into the on side
goes after a fairly reasonable delivery. Length ball on middle and leg, and he stretches out and sweeps it away through square leg, gets it past short leg's left shoulder, and manages to find the gap
length ball on middle and leg, goes back to defend
length ball outside off, left alone
shot! That's Root's trademark shot, the sweep from well outside off stump, hit a long way in front of square. Square leg was in front of square, but he beats him to his left
flat and full on middle stump, keeps his front leg out of the way and defends into the off side
full, a bit of drift in towards middle stump, driven to mid-off

good ball, on a length, pitching around middle and off and continuing with the angle into the right-hander. Looks to defend, playing for a bit of turn, and the ball rolls away into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
super shot. Goes deep in his crease to a flat length ball on middle and off, and uses his wrists to whip it wide of mid-on. And he's overstepped, not for the first time today
oh, superb shot. And this Chepauk outfield is like all Chepauk outfields. A touch too full on middle and leg, and he clips it away effortlessly to the left of square leg
goes back to a length ball on off stump, and defends with soft hands into the off side
straighter line, goes back again to defend towards midwicket
flatter, on off stump, goes right back once more to defend with soft hands, right by his feet
ooh, the leg slip is waiting for exactly that. Some extra bounce after pitching middle and leg, and Root, looking to flick it away, hits it in his direction, but it falls short of the fielder
a touch short, pulled away to deep backward square leg
full on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, a bit of movement in towards off stump, goes right back to defend into the midwicket region
fullish, a bit of late inswing towards off stump. Stays a little leg-side of the ball to block into the covers
length ball, angling into the corridor, lets it come on and defends into the leg side
short, wide slower ball, dies off the pitch and bounces a second time before reaching the keeper. Sibley leaves it alone
length ball angling into off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, angling into leg stump, worked away to long leg
length ball, only a hint of turn in from outside off, defends from the crease
nicely played. Slightly back of a length, spinning in from off stump, and he swiftly makes room to punch to the left of mid-off and bring up his fifty. Gets another run courtesy a misfield as well
flat length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump, goes right back to defend to midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, gets forward to clip through square leg
full on off stump, gets forward to clip to short leg
back of a length in the corridor, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and keep it down to gully
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets back and across and works it away through backward square leg
length ball on off stump, defended into the on side, meeting it right under his eyes and almost withdrawing his bat upon impact
fullish, angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
edged, but falls well short of Rohit diving left from wide slip. Straightens from a length outside off, and Sibley was looking to defend off the front foot
follows up with a searing yorker tailing in towards middle stump. Pulls his front foot out of the way just in time and jams his bat down on it
back of a length, a touch straight, tucked off the hip behind square, but India have a fielder there at a wide-ish leg gully
tossed up on off stump, swept down to deep backward square leg. First time Root has swept Ashwin today
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to defend to square leg
flat length ball on middle stump, this is the undercutter, doesn't turn. Defended to midwicket
offbreak now, similar length and trajectory to the previous ball, clipped to short leg
gets this one to go straight too, outside off, but just slightly short and Sibley has time to go back and adjust and defend into the off side

polite appeal after the ball, spinning after pitching on middle and leg, pops up to short leg. Sibley was on the front foot to defend, and he ended up having to play around his front pad as this one turned more than expected. No bat, I think, just pad

big appeal from Bumrah as he hits the front pad, with Root moving too far across his stumps while attempting to flick. Not given, and India debate for a while before deciding not to review. Yeah, probably missing leg stump
looks for the yorker again, gets that inward shape once more. Manages to keep his pads out of the way and clips to long leg
bouncer outside off. Ducks, and the ball loops in tennis-ball fashion to the keeper
full, angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket. A few oohs and aahs because it was briefly in the air.
slower ball, angling down leg, gets a touch too far across and can't connect with the flick
full, angling into off stump, gets forward to push to the left of short extra-cover
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of mid-off
flat length ball on middle stump, stays back and blocks
once again, stays back to a length ball, defends in front of off stump
shot. Ashwin drops a rare one short, and Root pulls it away, past the left leg of the short leg fielder and through square leg
once again he drops a touch short, on off stump, and Root jumps back, makes a bit of room, and punches it away through cover point
tossed up on midddle and leg, clipped to midwicket
length ball on off stump, blocked to short cover
a bit of movement into the stumps, stays back and keeps it out
fuller, outside off, presses forward to block into the covers
full on middle stump, clipped to square leg

ooh, great delivery. Length ball, swinging into the corridor, towards the shiny side, and maybe straightening a touch past the outside edge. Or it didn't straighten, and just beat Sibley for pace, because he seemed late on it. May have skidded through quicker and slightly lower than expected
big legcutter, but it starts too wide to make Sibley play. And now Ishant has overstepped, but not by much. Heel was right on top of the line
length ball outside off, left alone
full on middle and off, a bit of away drift before pitching. Clipped to mid-on
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball on off stump, hangs back and defends square on the off side
this one seems to drift the other way, into the batsman, and pitches on leg stump, clipped watchfully to short leg
tossed up slower, just outside off swept along the floor to the left of long leg
length ball turning in towards off stump, gets on the front foot to defend
back of a length and darted outside off, keeps low, sneaks under Root's bat and barely carries to Pant
full and on a fourth-stump line, a crease-bound Root opens the face and guides it quietly to cover

edged, but does not carry to a diving Pant. Beautiful delivery from Ishant. Full, angling in towards off, which makes Root play, but it homes away so very late, snagging the outside edge. But it bounces in front of Pant lunging forward
short and ducks back in on middle, defensively dropped to the leg side off the back foot
a bit too full and straight, whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket
on a length and slanting in at off, knocked to short midwicket
shorter and spins away outside off, Root jumps back and forces it through cover
tossed up, fuller on middle, played back to Nadeem
shorter once again, Root goes deep in the crease and crunches it straight to extra-cover
dragged down on off, Nadeem has been too short today, while Washington has been a bit too full, hauled away to deep midwicket off the back foot
fuller and sliding in with the angle, clipped into the gap at midwicket

Nadeem needs to tighten up his lengths. Short and spins away outside off, Root leans back and scythes it away through point. Washington makes a hash of it in the outfield. He chases, dives awkwardly, and lets the ball roll away into the fence. Root moves past fifty in his 100th Test, and looks good for more
back of a length and angling into a leg-side flick
lifter outside off, Root sways his upper body out of the way
chest-high short ball on middle, 136ks, no pace in the pitch either. Root happily swivels back, rides the bounce, pulling to the right of Ashwin at long leg. Yet another no-ball from Ishant
Ishant ventures wide of the crease, but this length ball holds its line outside off, as opposed to slanting in. Root searches for it in the channel before belatedly tucking his bat inside the line
pitched further up on off, Root shows off his straight bat and bunts it to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, another firm back-foot punch through the covers
wide of the crease, full and angling into a leg-side clip to midwicket
Nadeem goes short and wide once again, gets away this time, as Root can only chop it as far as cover
tossed up slower and fuller, hint of turn, forward and pushed solidly to the covers
full, non-turner on middle, knocked to mid-on off the front foot
dropped short and wide, another loose delivery from Nadeem. Sibley rocks back and cracks it away to the left of backward point
loopier and fuller on off, Sibley stretches out to smother it
forward and dinked into the leg side
tailing into the right-hander rather late, but Root is able to keep his balance, his head is right over the ball, and as a result he flicks it quite smoothly to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, defends
swing into the right-hander from a good distance outside off, which is why Sibley is confident leaving that ball
good length, outside off, no shot
good stuff from Ishant. Pitches it up, drawing Sibley's reluctant front foot out of the safety of its crease. He still defends well enough against the reversing inswinger
a touch too straight and Sibley is able to flick it behind square leg
good stride forward to defend a tossed up ball on and around off stump
lets go a slightly flatter delivery that goes in with the arm and doesn't really miss off stump by too much.
sliding into leg stump, Sibley is hoping to tickle it around the corner, but it beats his inside edge and Pant makes a good take blindsided
defends a flighted delivery outside off. Strong stride forward again
forcefully works a full ball on middle towards midwicket. Pujara doesn't let it pass him
defends a flighted delivery on middle
back of a length with a little cut into the right-hander off the pitch. Not enough to threaten the stumps so Root leaves
gets it fuller and Root is immediately a little more careful, playing very close to his body and basically letting the ball strike the full face of his bat pointing down
hammers the ball, but it goes straight to point. Root is so so good once you give him a chance to get on the back foot and Bumrah does here with a rank short and wide delivery

su-weeeeetttt. He's on the front foot this time and that makes it almost picture perfect. This is NOT a half-volley. But Root storms forward. His balance is majestic. And then it's the hands. A simple extension of them gives him all the timing he needs to find a very crisp boundary at cover.
immediately Bumrah shifts his length back and Root is ready with a solid defensive block
tails into him but Root is hardly bothered by the threat. Solid front foot block again from the England captain
a hint of turn away from the bat, but not enough that Sibley is in any trouble
lunges forward on middle and leg to block again
flatter delivery, not much turn there, Sibley defends from the crease
steps out of his crease and then turns the ball towards midwicket
finds the gap to the right of mid-on and it's not much more than a push. Nadeem opens himself up to that punishment by sliding the ball into the pads of a batsman who is very good on the leg side
steps out - his confidence is soaring - and whips the full ball from outside off down to mid-on
rocks back and punches the shortish delivery outside off to the left of cover
supremely good yorker but Root is good enough for it, yanking his front leg away so that he can jam a straight bat down on the ferociously inswinging thing

goes for the bouncer this time, but Root is happy to drag it from way outside his right shoulder and to deep square leg. On bouncier pitches that's a risk, here, it's a run-scoring opportunity. Good batting. Good judgment.
slower ball from Bumrah now but Root is up to the task again. Solid defence in front of off stump
back of a length and way outside off, Root is happy to let it through
inside edge as Bumrah gets a good length ball to curl in sharply again. For once he catches Root in no-man's land, stuck on his crease, but he's still good enough to get bat to it
short once again, sliding in from around the wicket, Root goes back and forces the ball to point
Root now rolls out a sweep, taking a full ball from outside off and hauling it to deep midwicket
floated up on off stump, Sibley gets forward and drives to mid-on
on a length and drifts in towards the top of off, solidly blocked back to Nadeem
Sibely forays down the track, shorter and faster, hastily defended to the leg side
here comes Sibley once again: down the track and jabbed back to Nadeem
flat and sliding into leg stump, Root welcomes him back with a sweep, drilling it away to the left of leg slip for four
speared into middle stump, Root presses forward and defensively drop the ball to cover
much slower through the air on off stump, Root opens the face and glides it through the point region
darted on leg stump, jammed towards short midwicket
another sweep from Root, struck hard and flat to Nadeem at deep square leg
tossed on off stump, Root blocks to cover
and they come into play straightaway as Sibley pushes off the front foot
full and outside off, run away to the left of square short cover
Sibley uses his feet and strokes a length ball to the left of square short cover
floated outside off, largely holds its line, no shot
tossed outside off, Sibley stretches out and scoops in front of one of the two short covers
darted outside off, nothing doing from Sibley
full on middle, eased to mid-on off the front foot
Root shimmies out, meets a full ball early, dinks into the covers, and sets off
fired into off stump, 96.2ks, squeezed away to the leg side off the front foot
Washington likes to push it quicker, dabbed to the leg side once again
slower on off stump, played back to Washington
flat and attacking off stump, almost 95ks, played back to Washington once again to close out the over
short, wide, spins away, Root reaches out for a cut, chops to point
full and pretty wide outside off, Root fetches it from there and drags a sweep against the break. Skied to the right of Ashwin at mid-on
short, wide, lashed to point
Bam! Hauled away to the midwicket boundary. Full and wide, right in Root's slot, swept away with great authority
on a length and skidding in at off, Root plays back and defends
full on middle, Root turns it behind square and rushes to the other end. Both Nadeem and Washington aren't giving Kohli the control he's searching for
fired on middle, bunted down to mid-on
on a length and spins in a touch on middle, worked to short square leg off the back foot
pushed through outside off, Sibley goes forward and across to defend to the leg side
fired on middle from round the wicket, whipped to midwicket
on a length and spins in on off, of the quicker variety of course, defended
more quick spin for Washington, but the length is short, allowing Root to force it through midwicket
Nadeem switches to over the wicket, and Root rolls out a reverse-sweep. He dares to take it from the stumps and place it behind point. More a switch-hit than a reverse-sweep
dangled up on leg stump, some turn to beat the bat and hit the pad
pitches outside leg, Root is happy to kick it away
picked off the pads to square leg
tossed outside leg, dragged behind behind square with a sweep
on the pads once again, directed to long leg. Nadeem has overstepped, he'll have to re-bowl it
The extra ball has fetched England four. Starts on leg stump and spins away, dropped into the covers, Sibley aims for a single. Pant swoops down on the ball but the throw is wayward
flat on middle from round the wicket, whipped firmly to midwicket
short on middle, hangs back and whisks it away to short midwicket
tossed on leg or just outside leg, Sibley aims for a sweep, gets very little bat onto it, deflecting the ball to leg slip
whipped off the back foot through backward square leg. 200 up for England
darted on middle and leg, Root skips into the 90s with a top shot. He plants his front leg and crunnnnnnches it between midwicket and mid-on
forward and driven straight of mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, goes back and punches firmly to backward point
tossed up slow, angling into off stump, gets forward and defends with an open face to backward point
good length, angling into off stump, no turn. Gets forward to defend, and the ball rolls into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
shot. That's a quickish length ball just outside off stump, but the footwork is super-quick, to get back into his crease, give himself room, and stab the ball away to the right of backward point
tossed up on off stump, stretches out to block it back to the bowler
tossed up slow on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
shot, Sibley puts away the sweep. Length ball, pitching down leg and turning further down, and he gets down low to swat it away to the long leg boundary
length ball on leg stump, defended back to the bowler

looks for the sweep again, but the ball pitches closer to leg stump (though not in line with the stumps) and bounces a little more, while turning less than expected. Beats the top edge and hits front pad
quickish length ball on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
tossed up slow, worked away off the pad through backward square leg
tossed up slow outside off, driven to short extra-cover
with that field, or any field, you can't bowl short and wide, and Sibley easily cuts him away through point
dangled up on off, no return, stretches out and plays it back
full on off stump, big stretch out to smother it
shorter and outside off, chopped to cover
darted on middle from round the wicket, Root moves to 99 with a firm push past Washington
fired on leg stump, whisked away to short midwicket
flighted on leg stump, forward and clipped through the vacant spaces at square leg
darted on leg stump, Sibely now brings out a sweep of his own, struck flat and hard to deep square leg, where Gill lazily lets the ball through his legs
short on the hips, glanced through square leg to put Root back on strike

There it is! Root marks his 100th Test with a sublime century. He punches his fist, eases the helmet off his head and draws warm applause from the change room. A big hug from Sibley is also part of the celebrations. Played. Darted on the leg stump, no turn, neatly picked off through square leg
length ball dipping nicely on an off-stump line and turning in. Defended into the on side off the inner half
a bit slower outside off, swept away to long leg
tossed up slow on middle and leg, stretches out to defend to midwicket
flat, spinning into off stump, goes back and whips to midwicket
nice length on that middle-and-leg line again, clipped into the leg side

ooh, lovely flight from Ashwin. Sibley looks to step out and whip him from outside off, but he has no idea where the ball is because of the late dip. Ends up inside-edging into his pad and then it rolls away wide of slip
tossed up outside off, swept away backward of square

four more. Once you get it past the infield, it's usually four on this ground. Not a half-volley at all, on off stump, but Root skips forward, steps leg-side of the line, and drives sweetly between bowler and mid-off
flat, on leg stump, goes back to clip towards square leg
a touch short on off stump, makes room to punch into the point region
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump, gets back and across to defend it right by his feet
tossed up slow on off stump, big stretch out to clip to midwicket
down the track to this leg-stump ball, clipped to the right of mid-on

turn and bounce! Stretches forward to defend one pitching just outside off, and the ball leaps past his inside edge, misses the top of his pad, and beats both keeper and leg slip as well. Leg byes is the signal, but I don't know if it hit the pad
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length, a bit of width, punched into the vacant cover region
nicely bowled. Gets forward to defend outside off, and the ball initially drifts away and then spins in less than expected, past the outside edge to hit thigh pad
quicker now, goes back to defend in front of off stump
full, wide, a bit of outswing, left alone
length ball angling down leg, too far away to make contact with the flick

shot! Glorious. Full and wide, but not a half-volley, so Root, getting a nice stride forward, waits a touch longer and opens his face to drive it square, to the left of the man at cover, finishing with a high left elbow
full on off stump, driven smoothly towards mid-on
full, angling into off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
full, angling into the pads, clipped to the left of long leg
fullish, angling into middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket
full outside off, gets forward to drive to short cover
past the edge. Root is half-forward to defend this one in the corridor, and it hits the seam and straightens to beat him
and again! This one jags away even more than the previous one, as Root defends from the crease
length ball, wider outside off, left alone
length ball, closer to off stump, good stride forward to push into the point region with an open face
length ball, sixth-stump line, left alone
length ball, closer to off stump this time, looks like it straightened a touch too, but Sibley is happy to leave it
back of a length outside off, carries through nicely at shoulder height to Pant after Sibley leaves again
back of a length, a little wider, and Sibley leaves again
still that wide-ish line, a little fuller, left alone
full, angling into off stump, good stride forward to block into the covers
length ball angling into off stump, gets on the back foot to defend it back down the pitch

ooh, again that sharp inward angle in towards off stump, and did it keep a bit low? Root defends from the crease, and it hits quite low on the bat. And he seems to cramp up in one of his legs as soon as he plays the shot
short now, rising ball in the corridor. Gets off his feet to ride the bounce and defend into the point region
short again, but this one sits up off the pitch, just outside off, and Root pulls it to deep square leg
length ball angling into off stump, defended to midwicket
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, and Root plays his trademark jumping punch through point. There's a fielder out on the point boundary to keep it down to a single
back of a length close to off stump, defended off the back foot towards midwicket
full outside off, nice press forward to defend, gets right up to the pitch of the ball and kills it dead, almost as if he's playing a spinner
full outside off, blocked to short cover
length ball close to off stump, presses forward to block into the cover point region
length ball close to off stump, gets right behind it and blocks it
flat, at the pads, goes back and clips but can't get it past short leg
tossed up nicely outside off, presses forward to defend, and it doesn't turn as much as expected. Off the outside half of the bat behind point
full on middle stump, clipped to wide mid-on
a bit of dip again from Ashwin, on a middle-stumpish line. Presses forward to defend, and it takes the inside edge and rolls away to long leg
shot. Tossed up outside off, and he stretches out to drive into the covers
wham. Six and he's down with cramps. Tossed up outside off, and Root stretches out and slog-sweeps crisply, easily clears the midwicket boundary, and then falls over in agony
fullish, wide of off, left alone
full, angling into the stumps, blocked to mid-on
length ball outside off, scrambled seam, and Sibley leaves again. Pant collects in an ungainly manner, right n front of his chest
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
fullish, not too far outside off, good stride out to block into the covers
full outside off, and there's that big stride again, this time for a checked drive to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and stabs it to the right of backward point
goes back to a length ball spinning from off to leg, and punches it away through forward square leg. It's amazing how square some of his straight-bat punches go
tossed up on middle stump, stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
stays back to a length ball spinning in towards off stump, defends into the off side
and again, stays back to a fairly full ball, defends it back down the pitch. I don't think he's able to stretch too much right now
length ball fairly wide of off, left alone
length ball angling into off stump, stays on the back foot and blocks into the on side

big appeal, and it's given! Bumrah does what Bumrah does, for the second time today. Sibley has reviewed the lbw decision, though... Again, it's the quick, straight one, and this one is pitched right up too. Sibley, playing all around his front pad, is struck low, and the only doubt there can be is whether it might miss leg stump. There's no inside edge. Bam. That's struck his pad low, on the full, and it's smacking into a good chunk of leg stump according to ball-tracking. Outstanding innings from Sibley, and it's taken a Bumrah special to end it
nice and full slanting in at off from round the wicket, Stokes stabs it out to cover
on a length and on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, nothing doing from Stokes
on a length and in a similar channel, similar response from Stokes, left alone
pushed through on off stump, Root inches forward and blocks to the leg side
tossed up slower and higher outside off, not quite driveable length, though. Root presses forward and pushes wide of the covers
fullish and angling in towards off stump, Stokes plays it back to Ashwin
sliding in at off stump, no turn, Stokes gets forward and defends to the off side
on the pads, Stokes leans across and flicks to short midwicket
good length and sliding in at middle, Stokes covers up the line and defends back to Ashwin
o a length and slanting in at off stump, Root respects it with a forward-defensive as the ball dribbles away to cover
fractionally overpitched and homing into off stump, Root flicks it with the angle and swing to deep square leg
some extra bounce for Bumrah from back of a length, Stokes jumps back, rides the bounce, and runs it to point
fullish and slanting in at off, 137.5ks, played back to Bumrah
Bumrah nails the inswinging yorker from round the stumps, heading for the base of middle, Stokes jams his bat down and just about keeps it out
shortish and outside off, Stokes feels for it away from the body, gliding it between slips and gully to open his account for four. Rahane can only watch it roll away into the boundary
floated up on off stump, Root gets his head over the ball and defends it back
darted on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
Root ventures down the track, Ashwin finds a bit of turn and drags his length back, whisked away to mid-on once again
tossed up and dips at off, Root stretches out and plays it back to Ashwin
shorter and breaking into the hips, Root drops the ball square on the leg side
fired into the pads, quietly knocked to the midwicket region
good length, slanting in from outside off, but does not threaten off. Root judges it well and ignores it
back of a length and Bumrah gets it to skid back into Root, there's Bumrah exaggerated incoming angle to boot, pings the England captain on the thigh pad
Bumrah tests Root with a yorker now, tails in at off, Root squeezes it out. Not even a Bumrah special can get Root
shot, beautiful late cut from Root. Short and attached with width outside off, Root leans back and glides it behind point, no protection there in the deep
shorter and angling in at off, Root resolutely blocks it off the front foot
Bumrah aims for another inswinging yorker, comes out as a full-toss, which is tapped to mid-on
Ashwin puts it on off stump, Stokes moves forward in defence
on a length and skids in sharply, Stokes opts to go back in defence this time
loopier and wider of off, Ashwin makes Stokes reach out for the ball. Carved to mid-off
tossed up on or - or just a shade outside off - Stokes stays leg-side of the line and launches it over the bowler's head. Bam!
darted into the stumps, Stokes keeps it out
Ashwin has pulled his length back, finds some turn to go past the outside edge
Root presses forward to defend this incoming length ball to cover
back of a length and slanting in at off stump, Root shifts back and blocks
fullish and angling in at off stump, defensively dropped to the leg side
good length and sliding in at off, head over the ball, another tight forward-defensive to cover
on a length and tailing in at off, 141.5ks, Bumrah can't breach Root's defences (yet)
short and slanting in at off, too close for the cut, Root chops it hastily, then ensures it doesn't bounce back onto his own stumps
flatter and skidding in from around the wicket, Stokes stoops low to keep it out
Ashwin drags his length back, drifts in and breaks sharply outside off, Stokes shoulders arms. It raises a puff of dust from the Chepauk surface
pushed through outside off, Stokes opens the face, scoops it away towards Bumrah at point
flat, fast, into the stumps, defended
tossed up slower on off stump, played back to Ashwin
Ashwin attacks off stump once again, Stokes respects it and defends it back to the bowl
Root cries 'No' after dabbing a length ball from outside off to point
on a length and tailing in a touch at off stump, Root plays really close to his body and plays it back to Ishant
on a length and swerves back in from outside off, nothing doing from Root

nice and full, Ishant brings this full delivery back into Root and has the batsman falling over. Root eyes up the leg side, and is struck on the front pad in line with middle, but this seems to be heading down leg. Kohli decides against a review
full ad homing in at off, Root presses forward and blocks stoutly
on a length and sliding in at off stump, Stokes dares to sweep and ends up dragging it to square leg off the inner half
pushed through on middle, Root presses forward and works it to short midwicket
looped up on middle, no turn, Root deploys a massive stride and pushes it back to Ashwin
clipped to the left of short midwicket and right of mid-on for one
flat and sliding in at off, Stokes keeps it out
pushed through outside off, doesn't come back in, Stokes judges it well and shoulders arms
back of a length and homing in at off, a rare false shot from Root. He jabs at the ball from the crease and sends an inside edge to the square-leg region
full and slanting in at off from round the stumps, Stokes blocks to the covers
pitched up and outside off, tapped back to Ishant off the front foot
Stokes shuffles across, then gets in line with an incoming delivery on off and defends
whisked away to the right of mid-on for a single
full, threatens to angle it, but wobbles away outside off. Root hangs his bat inside the line and does well not to go after it in the channel
full and slides in at the stumps, Stokes keeps back and blocks to the leg side
short and spins away outside off, Stokes leans back and chops to cover
powered to the square boundary. Pushed through on off, no turn, Stokes deploys a big stride and nails a sweep to the square-leg fence
glanced off the hips to deep midwicket, there's protection in the deep after that swept four
looped up and dips at off, Root gets forward to smother it
drifting into the leg stump, now it's Root's turn to sweep it flat and hard to long leg
good length, Ishant continues to probe away on and around off. Root solidly defends once again
on a length, Root gets forward and blocks to cover on off stump
mighty full and swerves back in. Ishant has Root playing around his front pad and falling over, but this is definitely heading down the leg side
on a length and outside off, Root opens the face and guides to cover
good length and outside off, run away towards cover-point
full and largely holding its line around off, Root jabs to the covers
Nadeem tosses it outside off, aiming for the rough, reverse-swept from the stumps to point
sliding in at the stumps, Stokes goes back and pokes it to the covers
Stokes leans across off and secures a single to the leg side
good length and aiming for the top of off, Root defends solidly
pushed through, Nadeem shifts his line wide of off, Root likes it there. So, he rolls out the sweep and beats Ishant to his left in the outfield even as he slides
darted on the stumps, played back to the bowler

Ishant brings another one back into Stokes, but this is just too full and finishes on the pads. Picked away between midwicket and mid-on. Gill, I think, chases hard, but the ball beats him and rolls into the boundary
Ishant overpitches it once again, Stokes has enough width to work with this time. He opens the face and creams it through the cover-point region for back-to-back fours
good length and slanting in at off and middle, pushed to mid-on
on a length and outside off, Ishant drags Stokes into a drive. Stokes simply reaches out in the channel with his hands and inside-edges it into the pitch
Stokes gets right behind the line of this full ball angling in at off and defends back to Ishant
back of a length and slanting in at off, just no pace off the pitch, Stokes has ample time to defend this back to Ishant
did that keep a bit low? Back of a length, angling into off stump and turning away, Root winces as he jabs it into the covers
tossed up wider outside off, driven to deep point
tossed up slow outside off, and he stretches out to lap it away, with the spin, into the fine leg region. Just met it with the bat face facing up, and scooped it away
quicker, on off stump, defended off the back foot into the off side
back of a length on middle and off, worked away to deep square leg
a touch short, close to off stump, punched to deep point
goes back to a length ball that spins fairly sharply from outside off. Cramps him for room, and he punches it back to the bowler
tossed up fuller outside off, stretches out and blocks it away
goes on the back foot again as Ashwin goes a little wider, defended right under his eyes
flat, angled into the pads, clipped to the right of forward square leg
shortish skidder angling into off stump, punched to mid-on
a touch short again, just outside off, makes a bit of room and stabs it to the left of point
flat length ball turning into the stumps, goes on the back foot and blocks it back towards the bowler
tossed up wider outside off, and Stokes shows again that he's prepared to sweep that line, out to the left of long leg
full, angling into a middle and leg line, defended into the on side, nice stride forward
nice length, pitching just outside off and drawing Root forward to defend into the covers
fuller, closer to off stump, driven to mid-off
nicely bowled. Invitingly flighted on off stump, and Root is slightly deceived in the air while driving inside-out. The ball hangs in the air briefly on its way to deep point
stays back to a marginally short ball close to off stump, and has all the time in the world to push into the point region with an open face
flat, angling in and straightening towards off stump, goes back and defends into the on side
flat again, angling into leg stump, reverse-swept firmly to backward point

nearly gets another wicket off the reverse sweep! Or has he? India have reviewed this one...  Stokes seemed to premeditate against this one, and it's fired in on a stump-to-stump line. Through his shot early, and the ball strikes his glove and pops up before landing safely behind square on the off side. India thought it hit his pad rather than his glove. That can happen - India lose a review
tossed up slow on off stump, presses forward and blocks into the covers
goes back to a quicker length ball on middle and off, defends square on the off side
length ball close to off stump, defended with an open face to backward point

big appeal for lbw, and it isn't given. Nadeem is convinced he has Root, and Kohli agrees to ask for the review... Nicely bowled, he's been hitting some good lengths in his last two overs. Root is forward to defend, he plays for turn, and the ball goes past his inside edge to hit his front pad. It went close to his inside edge but missed. The line is good, but the bounce, according to ball tracking, would have taken it over leg stump. It looked close, though. India lose another review, but this was one they were probably right to take
tossed up wide of off stump, and deep square leg is in place to mop up after Root unfurls his sweep
flat length ball angling in from wide of the crease and spinning in towards middle and leg. Goes back to defend to short leg

ooh, that jumped out of nowhere. There are a few footmarks outside the left-hander's off stump, and this probably landed in that area. Jumps up to hit Stokes' glove and then his forearm and fall safely to the leg side. Could have gone anywhere
and again, Stokes is contorted into fending awkwardly. Bounce out of the footmarks, and the ball beats his inside edge and hits his stomach. Wow
length ball close to off stump, goes back and punches through point
goes back to a fairly full ball on the stumps, and is hurried into a defensive jab into the point region
tough chance, dropped. Down the track to the flighted ball, driven back firmly, but in the air. Ashwin sticks his right hand out, but it just doesn't stick
tossed up outside off, presses forward and smothers it
a bit of flight, lands on an inviting length outside off, driven firmly into the covers
flat length ball on the stumps, goes right back and clips to square leg
tossed up outside off, stretches out to sweep and misses. The keeper appeals loudly, but it struck him outside the line. Then Pant says 'it wasn't too far outside'
was that another tough chance? Yeah, another drop. Powerful sweep from outside off, and Pujara, diving full-length to his left, reaches out with his left hand, but again it doesn't stick
tossed up outside off, Root brings up 150 with a checked drive through cover point. He's just gone on and on, and he hasn't lost any of his fluency. Well played!
tossed up outside off, stretches out and drives to extra-cover
tossed up wider now, looking for the footmarks, but it's just about full enough for Stokes to reach out and meet it with a hefty slog-sweep that easily clears the midwicket boundary
full on off stump, clipped wide of mid-on
tossed up outside off, and Stokes doesn't get forward to drive the ball hangs in the air for a while before falling short of mid-off

full, on the stumps, clipped away through backward square leg. Looks like there was a chance of a run-out if the throw from Washington Sundar was good, but it wasn't, and Pant is drawn too far away from the stumps
tossed up slow outside off, presses forward and blocks
goes back to a length ball spinning in from outside off, defends with soft hands

dangled up wide of off again, and Stokes brings out the reverse-sweep. Risky shot, he's not quite got his head over the ball, but he hits it hard, in the air, and there's no one in the point region, just a short third man who's too fine to stop this
and again. Similar line and length, and an even more controlled response, all along the ground this time. Brings up an excellent counterattacking fifty
quickish length ball close to off stump, goes back and defends into the off side
goes back again, this one's slightly shorter, meets it with soft hands and it drops right by his feet
flat, back of a length, outside off, goes back and defends again, showing the full face
full, gets forward to clip to midwicket
goes on the back foot to punch this length ball from just in front of off stump, through cover point
goes back to a quickish length ball on off stump and defends close to his body
again, trusts in his back-foot game, defends from just in front of off stump, back too the bowler
tosses it up fuller and wider, and Stokes drives powerfully to mid-off
now he's half forward to a quickish one that slides on towards off stump, manages to defend without too much discomfort
back of a length, spins in towards middle and leg, goes back to clip to midwicket
tossed up a bit more outside off, presses forward to block into the covers
a bit more flight, on off stump, swept firmly but can't beat the man at square leg
ooh, there's some extra bounce again. Fired in quickly into the pitch, and he ball leaps up towards his ribs. Fends at it awkwardly, and manages to keep it down. Off the glove, I think
down the track now, gets close to the pitch of this middle-and-leg ball to clip wide of mid-on
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, a bit of shape in towards off stump, goes back to clip through square leg
back of a length, angling into the stumps, goes back and defends close to his body
looks for the middle-stump yorker, gets his front leg out of the way and clips to midwicket
length ball on off stump, continues to trust his back foot game, defends into the off side
back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked away behind square

wow. He already almost had Stokes bowled with a searing yorker. Now he fires one in at Root, and he plays it so well, pulling his front foot out of the way and jamming his bat down, right on top of the ball.
full on middle and leg, blocked back down the pitch, to the left of the bowler
in the blockhole on off stump, squeezed out to short extra-cover
full on middle stump, defended to mid-on
bam. Gets his front leg out of the way to slog-sweep this ball from just outside off, wide of the man at straight midwicket
better length, quickish and skidding on towards off stump, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
tossed up a bit slower, on off stump, and out he stretches again, and this time he sweeps just in front of square, and finds the boundary once again
length ball, a bit of late swerve in towards off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and dabs defensively towards gully
stays back to another length ball on off stump, and defends with soft hands into the covers. The fielder at extra-cover is quite deep, so he can pick up a quick single
fullish outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, half-volley, was looking for the yorker and underpitched. Ensures his front leg is out of the way and clips it away effortlessly, between midwicket and square leg
length ball, a tiny hint of shape in towards middle stump. Stays back in his crease and defends it back to Bumrah
fullish, close to off stump, defended into the covers from the crease. Oh, and Bumrah has overstepped again. Not by much, to be fair to him
low full-toss on off stump, looking for that yorker again. Blocked carefully to mid-on
full outside off, driven to mid-off
tossed up outside off, big stretch forward to block it back
full, close to off stump, strides out and clips to mid-on
quicker on off stump, makes a bit of room and stabs it into the point region
tossed up on middle and off, blocked to mid-on
floated up full on leg stump, defended gently into the on side of the pitch
shortish and outside off, Root hops, rides the bounce, and steers the ball to gully
much fuller and bending into the pads, diverted away through square leg as Root doesn't get enough bat on the leg-side flick
on a length and outside off, angling away further, Stokes ignores it
back of a length and slanting away, finishes on a set of stumps outside off - or even wider - left alone by Stokes
short on the hips, Stokes shuffles across off and secures a single to the left of short midwicket
Root gets right behind the line of this length ball on off and blocks it to the leg side
Nadeem attacks the rough outside off, finds some turn, jabbed off the back foot behind square on the leg side
tossed on the rough outside off, Stokes pre-meditates a sweep and wears it on the body
Nadeem drags his length back, whipped with the spin through midwicket
Root leans back and finds the gap between point and covers - like only he can. He jumps back, meets this short ball outside off, and scythes it away
dangled up on off stump, nice and full, Root smothers it off the front foot
flat and skidding into middle, Root works it with the angle to the midwicket region. This single brings up the century stand between Root and Stokes
on a length and heading towards off stump, Root's back-foot defensive intervenes
a touch too full and straight, glanced to midwicket's right
good length and angling into off stump, Root covers the line and plays it back to the bowler
Root ventures forward and defends this length ball bending in at off. Ishant is searching for reverse
pitched up and largely holds its line outside off, driven through the line. Ishant lunges to his left from his followthrough and partially stops the ball
pitched up and bending in at off, 140.4ks, Root squirts it to the covers and closes out the over
dragged down on off stump, Stokes jumps back and swats it powerfully to deep midwicket where Washington collects the ball
pushed through on off stump, Root gets forward to dead-bat it away
Root goes back to force this shorter ball from outside off to point
tossed up at off stump, forward and squeezed to short cover
dragged down outside off once again, Root hauls it away to the right of long-on off the back foot
here comes Stokes: dashes down the track, manufactures his own length, and sends Nadeem clattering over the long-on boundary. Extends his hands and belts it away
good length and angling into off, poked to the left of cover
back of a length and a touch too straight, knocked away to the right of midwicket
short and slanting in on middle, blocked to midwicket
slower-ball full-toss from Bumrah, 98ks dipper. Stokes waits for it and then forces it away in the gap at midwicket. He finds the fence
Bumrah cranks it up to 140.2ks, short and outside off, Stokes can't connect with a pull
dug in short at the top of off, Stokes keeps it out
flighted and spins away outside off, Root allows the ball to turn, then chops it away wide of slip
Stokes dares to reverse-sweep out of the rough, he does not get hold of it, this he gloves it past the keeper to short fine leg
shorter and outside off, Stokes goes very deep in the crease and jabs through the vacant cover-point region. Pant chases the ball hard
guided off the face through backward point
flighted and drifts in on middle and leg, Root brings his wrists into play and collects a double through midwicket
pushed through on off, Root gets forward and dead-bats it away
short of a length and slanting away outside off, Stokes fends at it and sends an outside edge dribbling away behind point
back of a length and angling away outside off, Stokes jumps across, and jabs the ball away to midwicket
back of a length and slanting away just outside off, Stokes plays with soft hands, dabbing the ball to gully
shorter and outside off, the ball comes so very slowly off this pitch, Stokes chops it through backward point
Bumrah searches for another yorker, but slants this down the leg side, away from the reach of Root's attempted glance
Bumrah is unveiling all his variations: here comes the lifter, Root is happy to duck out of the way

Finally, finally India find a way past this pair (or Stokes just gives it away). Finally, finally Nadeem has something to show for his toil. Tossed up on the leg stump, Stokes aims a slog-sweep, but doesn't quite hit it as firmly as he did earlier in the day. He holes out to square-ish long leg, where Pujara just about clings onto the ball after an awkward juggle
tossed outside off, driven away to the left of short cover
sliding into the pads, dinked to midwicket
darted on the stumps, played back to the bowler
slow, short, spins away outside off. Pope skips back and lines it up with a cut. Cracked away behind point for his first boundary
pushed through faster and fuller outside off, stabbed back to Nadeem
another bouncer that flies through to the keeper as Root ducks
short on the hips, duly tucked away towards long leg
attempted yorker swerving down the leg side, fine take from Pant diving low to his left
on a length and outside off, Pope plays away from the body, jabbing the ball down to gully

nice and full, threatens to bend in, but straightens late to graze the back pad on its way to the keeper. The appeal is shot down, and India opt against a review of the on-field not-out decision. Looked like it had hit Pope outside the line of off
another yorker from Bumrah, kept out
good length and angling in, defended
much fuller on off, dead-batted away
pushed through on the pads, Root shuffles across and dinks a single into the leg side
tossed outside off, blocked
darted on middle, played back towards the bowler
tossed up, turns and bounces outside off to beat Root's sweep
overpitched on off stump, flicked with the angle to long leg
short of a length and angling into the body, Pope shuffles across and clips it straight to midwicket
full-toss, reverses in at off, picked off to midwicket
full and holds its line outside off, no shot
full and straight, tinged with reverse-swing, bunted to midwicket
full and straight, turned to midwicket
back of a length and spins away outside off, Root punches crisply off the back foot to the off-side sweeper
short and spin, of the quicker variety, cut off the back foot to point
Pope stretches out to defend this full ball on off back to the bowler. Nadeem has overstepped again
full and skidding in at off, Nadeem draws an inside edge as the ball rolls to long leg
swept from the stumps to long leg
Pope uses his feet and quietly smothers this full ball on off
floated up on off stump, no turn, played back to the bowler
bouncer down the leg side, Root swerves out of the way and lets it fly through to Pant
banged in short and outside off, Root controls a pull to deep midwicket
slower delivery on the pads, barely 110ks, nurdled to square leg
very full on off stump, tapped to mid-off
very full and tinged with some reverse again, worked to midwicket
full and homing in at off, resolutely defended to cover
goes back to a length ball spinning in towards middle stump, defends into the off side
down the track to a flighted off-stump ball, clips quietly to midwicket
flighted ball on off stump, good stride forward to block into the covers
right back in his crease to a quicker one on off and middle, defended with utmost solidity
now a couple of inches further outside off, goes back and across to clip to midwicket
more air now, outside off, and Root jumps out and clips towards long-on
goes back to a length ball on off stump, opens his bat face and pushes into the covers
back of a length, spinning in from outside off, goes back and across to work it to midwicket
down the track to the off-stump ball, clipped to mid-on
fuller and quicker on off stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up slower on off stump, and now it's Pope's turn to reverse-sweep. Gets close to the pitch and checks his shot to pick up one into the cover point region
flighted ball close to off stump, good stretch forward to block it
quickish length ball on middle stump, gets his front pad out of the way and clips watchfully into the on side
quick again, a bit shorter, on middle and off, goes back to defend towards midwicket
full on middle stump, uses his wrists to whip it back to the bowler
flatter, some turn into middle from outside off, goes back to work it to square leg
carrom ball on leg stump, goes back to work it to deep forward square leg
tossed up slow outside off, gets forward to open his bat face and steer to backward point
full flighted ball close to off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
quick length ball on off stump, defended back down the pitch
goes back to one that's slightly shorter, similar line, defended to midwicket
