nicely bowled, a hint of drift away from off stump before spinning back in. Defended solidly off the front foot
goes deep in his crease to clip this off-stump length ball to midwicket
quick length ball on middle stump, defended to midwicket, and that's Washington's first maiden, in his 17th over
middle-stump line, fullish length. Stays back in his crease to block that to midwicket
whack. That's hit really hard by Root. Jumps out as he sees a bit of air, gets close to the pitch, and hits it back, hard and straight, forcing Pope to duck at the non-striker's end
dangled up slower now, dips onto a good length just outside off and spins back in, defended back to the bowler
goes back to a flatter one on the stumps, defends to midwicket
slower again, slightly wider outside off, gets a good stride forward, then waits, and then defends with soft hands
beaten in the air again. Looks to step out and the ball drifts away from him a little. Brings his wrists into play to jab it back to the bowler

quick single as Root goes on the back foot to work this to the left of square leg. A bit of excitement from the Indian fielders, but the man at square leg was running towards his wrong hand, so the single is easily completed
down the track to the tossed-up ball on off stump, clipped away wide of mid-on
down the track again, and this time he gets closer to the pitch so he can punch this back with a straight bat. Quickly past the bowler diving to his right, and mid-on is left with no chance
tossed up slow outside off, big stretch out to defend
length ball spinning in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
goes back this time, looking to work the length ball from middle and leg. Can't get it past short leg
down the track as Sundar flights this one wider outside off. Steps across and blocks into the on side
shot. That ball is finishing slightly outside leg stump, and it isn't short, but this pitch is slow enough for Root to go back, make room and punch it to the left of mid-off
undercutter going on straight towards leg stump, goes back to defend into the on side
mix-up, but Pope dives back to safety. Steps out to clip this one to the right of Kohli at midwicket. He sprints quickly and flicks in a throw on the dive, but Pope has turned back in time
down the track again, not close enoiugh to the pitch to attack it, jabbed back to the bowler
goes back to one angled across to off stump, deep in his crease to work it towards square leg

India are convinced they've got Pope here, but Anil Chaudhary is unmoved. India have reviewed after much deliberation... Looked to sweep, and the ball popped up to the fielder at leg gully. The ball pitched on or just outside leg stump, and dipped a bit. Pope is through his shot early, and the ball bounces , misses his bat, and I think it's missed his gloves and hit his right forearm. What does Ultra-Edge say? No bat, no glove, it's off the forearm. But that means he can still be lbw. It's pitched just in line with leg stump, the impact is umpire's call, and the ball is bouncing well over leg stump

shot. Floated up full on off stump, and it ends up as a full-toss as Root reaches out and reverse-laps it to the right of the keeper. Pant sticks his right leg out but the ball has already flown past him by then
full, close to off stump, nice stride forward to push to the left of mid-off
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, clipped to long-on
full on off stump, punched to long-on with a straight bat
back of a length outside off, waits a long time, deep in his crease, before dabbing it into the point region
goes back to this off-stump ball and clips it to the left of square leg, where Nadeem gets up too early and fails to cleanly pick the ball up. No single nonetheless
full on leg stump, clipped watchfully into the square leg region
length ball, angling across to off stump, not a lot of turn in. Goes deep in his crease and pushes gently into the covers
tossed up on leg stump, gets forward, front pad away from the line, to defend inside-out into the off side
tossed up outside leg, and out comes the reverse-sweep, to the right of the fielder at backward point, It's a tight single, but they make it fairly easily in the end
tossed up full on off stump, presses forward to push to the left of extra-cover
nicely played. Good-length ball on the stumps, and he collapses his back knee to make himself room to sweep it fine of the man at backward square leg
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come, makes some room, and opens his bat face to steer to the left of backward point
short, wide, slapped to deep point
very full on middle stump, clipped gently to the right of midwicket
nicely flighted on middle and off, defended with the turn to short extra-cover
goes back to a good-length ball outside off, and cuts it firmly to backward point

big appeal for lbw, but the umpire is unmoved. A bit of bat, maybe? Good bit of bowling from Nadeem, dipped onto a good length and kept going with the angle from around the wicket as he came forward to defend. Thick inside edge into pad
Now England are playing all their shots. This is fired in full, at middle and leg, and he calmly brings out the reverse lap to the right of the keeper
sweeps a full ball on off stump, to the left of deep square leg

down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, times his footwork perfectly to get to the perfect position to swing smoothly through a lofted drive and clear the long-on boundary comfortably. Brilliant way to bring up yet another double-hundred. And knowing the total he has his sights on, he'll look to carry on just as he's been going
down the track, gets close to the pitch of this and clips towards mid-on
quicker, on the stumps, gets forward to work this to midwicket
length ball on middle and off, gets forward and blocks to the on side
goes back to a length ball outside off, stabs to the left of backward point. Nadeem has been unable to prevent singles in that direction
shorter, wider, cut to backward point. Was briefly in the air, after he reached out to play it
flatter and quicker, closer to off stump, rocks right back to chop it to backward point

stretches out to a slower, flightier ball on off stump, tries to sweep, and gets an inside edge that rolls away fine. Or did he get any bat on it? Seemed to beat his bat and bounce right over leg stump
angled down leg now, swept away nice and fine
tossed up on off stump, gets forward to defend, off the inside half of the bat into the square-leg region. England are getting a single virtually every ball now
loopy full-toss on off stump, punched down to long-on
nice flight on off stump, very full, clipped to straight midwicket
tossed up wide of off stump, steps out and drives firmly to mid-off's left
nicely flighted outside off, clipped to straight midwicket
back of a length, spinning down leg, goes back and nurdles it behind square
turn, but slow turn, from outside off, and Pope makes room for a gentle dab into the cover point region
shortish, spinning away outside off, left alone
there again, shortish and wide, looking to feed the cut. Hits it firmly to deep point
quicker one, sliding on towards middle and leg, goes right back to block it back to the bowler
another slider on the stumps, a bit fuller but Root is still deep in his crease to defend into the leg side
tossed up slow outside off, left alone
sweeps from just outside off, a bit of a top edge, and it's briefly in the air, but it falls safely well short of the man at deep square leg
tossed up slow, wide of off, driven to the sweeper at deep cover
nice length, spins back in from outside off, defended with the turn into the on side
lovely loop outside off, steps out but can't quite get to the pitch to drive. Blocked back to the bowler
there's that loop again. Skips out one step, then it spins back in with a bit of extra bounce, and he defends with his bottom hand off the handle
short now, and even though it turns quite sharply from outside off, Pope has all the time in the world to make room and cut to deep point
loopy full-toss on off stump, delivered with a bad parody of Harbhajan Singh's action. Punched down to long-on to bring the session to a close
pitched up and angling in towards middle, gently knocked back down the pitch
back of a length and sharply slanting in at off stump, blocked back to the bowler. Bumrah will have to re-bowl that because his front foot has strayed
back of a length and outside off, lashed to sweeper cover. The man in the outfielder is squarer and runs across to tidy up
full and holds its line outside off, Root ignores it. The ball dies on its way to Pant
shortish and tailing in towards the top of off, Root stands up tall and blunts it to the off side
on a length and outside off, run away to the left of gully off the front foot
full and outside off, Root presses forward and dinks a single into the covers
goes back to a good length ball on middle and nudges it to midwicket
prefers to play from the crease again and he has to hurry into a defensive push against a fairly full ball on off stump
slows his pace down a bit and Root is able to turn it towards midwicket
drives smoothly to long-on
loops it up wider outside off stump against the newer batsman, Pope is able to get forward and smother the turn
goes back to a flatter ball on leg stump and blocks it
turns a length ball on middle through midwicket
outside edge but it goes to ground and then skips away between the first slip and the gully fielder. A bit of an airy drive on the up and away from the body from Pope...
sharp angle into the right-hander and Pop does well to present the full face of the bat to it
another fierce delivery from Bumrah - 142 kph - and tailing into the blockhole. But Pope watches it well, keeps his balance and works it to deep square leg
hints of swing into the right-hander, Root is solidly behind it
back of a length on off stump, blocks it
goes back to block a length ball on middle
slower through the air but since it's loopy and outside off stump, Pope gets down on one knee and reverse paddles the ball. Lovely connection, waits for the ball so nicely

Miscue! Lobs over the keeper! Pant's going in the wrong direction! And it all happens off a filthy full toss. Root thinks he can whack it over midwicket, only he gets a top edge that bobbles away behind him. Pant randomly went searching towards point and in the end Rohit from leg slip catches up with the ball
clips a full ball to mid-on
defends a full ball on middle
flighted on middle, turns it into the leg side
goes back to block a flatter delivery on middle
eases it down the ground to long-off
keeps a bit low as Pope backs away to cut the short ball - he read the length so early - and has the reflexes to adjust to the lack of bounce too. Single to the sweeper
clips it off his pads through midwicket
good footwork again as he wiggles outside leg stump to punch a quicker delivery on middle into the covers
leans into the tossed up ball meant to draw him to play away from the body, but because of that long stride forward, he is right on top of it as he drives to cover
goes back to flick a good length ball on middle through to deep midwicket

gives him out lbw and Pope will not avail himself of a review. Good call in the end. he's right in front of middle.Good work from Ashwin. Even with this pitch not offering any turn, he has found a way to hoodwink a batsman. Pope is playing for this non-existent, mythical turn. He is playing down the wrong line. And a full length ball pitching on off stump casually drifts past the leading edge of the bat and pins him

caaaaatttttch is the cry! And it almost carried to short midwicket! Glorious bowling from Ashwin. He knows with a new batsman in the middle, he has the licence to loop the ball up, dangle it wide outside off and lure him into hitting against whatever turn the pitch offers. Inside edge nearly does Buttler in
steps out of his crease and to the pitch of a fullish delivery on middle and works it to midwicket
nudges a tossed up ball on middle to square leg
slightly short and slides in, punched back to Nadeem off the back foot
on a length and skidding in at the stumps, Buttler opts to play back as an inside edge wanders behind square on the leg side
short and spins away outside off, smeared off the back foot to sweeper cover
full and drifts into the pads, Buttler plays back once again, deflecting the ball behind square for one
jabbed to the right of point off the back foot

Nadeem wins an lbw appeal from umpire Menon, Root calls for a review almost immediately. Pushed through flat, straightens just enough from around the wicket, Root has a short stride and plays around his front pad. Struck on the front pad, below the knee-roll in line with middle. If there's no bat, this looks adjacent. No inside edge and the tracker returns three reds. Root's marathon is over. Stunning innings, and he's warmly welcomed back by his mates in the dressing room. From out of nowhere, two in two overs for India
pushed through on middle, defended
flighted on off stump, run away square on the off side
worked off the pads to the right of midwicket to deep square leg
tossed up on middle, dips, glanced to the leg side
sliding in at off stump, defended to short leg
good length and spins in, blocked to the left of short leg
tossed outside off and spins away a touch, guided to point
darted on off, played up to short cover
full and holds its line outside off, patted away to the left of short cover this time
dangled up outside off, Bess isn't tempted, left alone in the channel
full and angling into the pads, tucked around the corner
good length, drifts in, beats Buttler's inside edge, bounces over the stumps, and beats the keeper as well
stabbed back to Ashwin, the ball bursts through his hands, but Buttler decides against a risky single
back of a length and spinning in, defended to short leg
flat on middle and leg, kept out
more spin for Ashwin, of the slower variety, takes the pad and bounces before leg-slip gathers it
pushed through on middle, keeps a bit low, Buttler goes low to keep it out
Buttler stands tall and punches a single down to long-on
pushed through just a shade outside off, defended off the front foot
Buttler stretches out, gets his hands low, and lap-sweeps a single to fine leg
flatter and quicker on off, defended to cover off the back foot
on a length and drifts in at off stump, Buttler covers up in defence
swept from the stumps down to long leg for another single
flighted outside off, Bess shimmies out and drives down to mid-on
full and on off stump, Buttler plays back and pushes it back to Ashwin
tossed up higher and slower on off, Buttler gets forward to smother it
on a length on middle, knocked to short leg off the back foot
tickled to square leg
speared into the pads, blocked to short leg
Buttler presses forward and defends to the right of short leg
flighted on middle, whisked away to the left of midwicket
sliding in on off, even fuller, Bess plays back and defends it to Nadeem
on a length and drifts in from outside off, tight leave from Bess
tossed up slower, 78ks, hint of extra bounce, popped in the air but wide of short leg
fired into middle and leg, stabbed to the leg side
floated up on a fourth-stump line, pushed back to Nadeem
short and attached with width outside off, Buttler has ample time to shift back and punch it strongly to the left of cover
slower, shorter, wider, Buttler goes deeper in the crease and rifles a cut to the cover boundary this time
tossed on middle, Buttler plays back and blocks it to Ashwin
sliding in at off stump, defended off the back foot by Buttler
full and angling in on middle, blocked to short leg
Buttler plays back and defends another full ball on the stumps
pushed through on middle, played back
full on off, guided to cover
pushed through outside off, tapped between covers and point
floated up on off, forward and smothered
short and skidding in on middle, forced off the back foot to midwicket
on a length and sliding across from around the wicket, blocked back
pushed through on off, blocked to cover off the front foot
pushed squarer to point off the front
fired on off stump, straightens a bit, defended off the back foot
seems to pitch outside leg and then hit Buttler's pad
full and sliding across off, Buttler aims a booming cover-drive but ends up being beaten
tossed on off, defended back
down the track, Nadeem pulls his length back, Bess drags a pull only as far as mid-on
flighted on off, full, defended
floated up wide of off, left alone
left alone outside off once again as another one goes on with the arm
speared into the pads, turned to the right of midwicket
starts off with a full-toss, Bess is probably surprised by it, jabbed back
darted on middle, defended back to Washington
down the track, and punched down to long-on

Washington and Pant go up in unison. They think they have their man. Umpire Chaudhary, though, shoots down the caught-behind appeal. Washington pleads with the umpire, then goes down on his haunches. On a length and drifts away outside off, draws an iffy prod from a crease-bound Buttler. Did that graze the outside edge? India don't have any reviews left to challenge Chaudhary's not-out call. Washington will wait to wait for his maiden Test wicket at his home ground
Washington now overpitches it just outside off, Buttler doesn't need any second invitations, laced to the cover fence
tossed on middle, kept out
goes back to one that slides in with the angle and cramps him for room. Jabbed into the covers
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, doesn't quite reach the pitch of it for the lofted drive. Miscues it slightly but clears mid-off comfortably
now Bess steps out, this one's straighter, and he punches firmly towards midwicket
flatter, goes back to punch this back to the bowler from an off-stumo line
ooh, tight leave. Nice length from Nadeem outside off, and this didn't turn

ooh, he's not had a great Test match so far but he's bowled some beauties every now and then. Another one pitches on the perfect length just outside off and zips through, going with the angle. Bess's bat comes down at an angle in defence, and it slices into the gap between bat and pad and narrowly misses off stump
tossed up on off stump, steps out and drives it back to the bowler
again Sundar beats the batsman with lack of turn. Presses forward to defend one that dips a lot shorter than he may have anticipated and it beats his outside edge and hits his thigh pad
down the track now, and again Bess doesn't reach the pitch of the ball. This one spins in, and the inside edge runs away to the right of short leg
now the ball doesn't turn as he comes forward to defend, and the outside edge rolls to the left of backward point
turn again, from the line of the stumps. Comes half-forward to defend, and the inside edge goes between the keeper and Kohli at leg gully
presses forward now, and dabs with an open face to the left of backward point
tossed up on middle and leg, steps out and clips to short leg
fired in quickly, slightly down the leg side and Bess tickles it away fine
short outside off, rocks back and cuts it away fiercely to the point boundary
down the track to the tossed-up ball on off stump, drives firmly and hits the stumps at the other end
tossed up, angling in from wide of the crease towards off stump. Presses forward and blocks into the covers. And Nadeem's overstepped again
floated up on middle stump, gets forward and works it away through backward square leg
goes back to a fairly full ball close to off stump, punches towards short cover, who moves swiftly to his left to stop it
tossed up loopily on an off-stump line. Steps out and gets too close to the pitch. Jabs it away towards point
turn and bounce, but down the leg side, left alone
down the track and Sundar bowls it quicker and shorter. Blocked back towards the bowler
shortish outside off, extra bounce too. Rides it and defends square on the off side
tossed up full on middle and leg, clipped towards square leg
another goes with the arm, close to off stump, but it's short enough for Bess to read it off the pitch and defend into the point region
unlucky Ishant. Back of a length outside off, and Buttler goes hard at it with an angled bat, looking to chop it away through point. Ends up inside-edging past his off stump to the fine-leg boundary

bowled him, big misjudgment from Buttler. I don't think it reversed - or if it did, it didn't reverse dramatically. May have been inward movement off the seam, actually. But whatever it was, it was too close to off stump for Buttler to be leaving it, and he hears a loud 'tunk' as soon as he takes that decision

wow, got him first ball, and that's Ishant's 299th Test wicket. Again, he hits a superb length just outside off, and gets it to nip back in to hit off stump. No footwork from Archer, he's stuck on his crease and jamming down ineffectually in defence as the ball bursts through. May have kept slightly low, perhaps, but not exaggeratedly so
keeps it out. This is another top-of-off ball, and he's playing from the crease, but he manages to squeeze it away wide of gully with an open face. And what's more, Ishant has overstepped
length ball angling into the pads. Looks to flick, misses, gets a leg bye into the backward square leg region
length ball, angling in from around the wicket towards off stump. Defended into the point region

edged, but it doesn't carry to wide slip. Rohit was well placed there, he didn't have to move at all, but the ball fell just short of him. Angled in towards off stump, fairly full length, inviting the drive. He goes for it with no real footwork, and gets a thick edge
tossed up close to off stump, gets forward to clip watchfully into the on side
again he goes past the outside edge. His lengths have been so much better in this spell. Pokes at it from the crease, no feet, and it goes with the arm and beats the outside edge
down the track to a slower, loopier ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven to long-on
overpitched on off stump, clipped into the midwicket region
down the track and Sundar fires it in quicker, at his feet. Clipped to midwicket
big appeal from the fielders behind the stumps as Leach pushes at a length ball outside off with hard hands. Straightens with extra bounce, and beats him by a distance
similar line and length, and Leach thinks about having a poke, before deciding just in time to leave it alone
beats him again. A touch shorter in the corridor, invites a back-foot jab, and it straightens to beat his outside edge
fullish, angling into off stump. Gets a decent stride forward to block into the covers
length ball, fifth-stump line, angling in and straightening, and once again Leach plays and misses, going half-forward this time
length ball, a little closer to off stump, gets forward and dabs to gully with an open face
once again Sundar goes past the outside edge. Presses forward to defend a good-length ball outside off, and it doesn't turn, zips past his edge
down the track, straighter line, clipped to straight midwicket
looks to shuffle out of his crease and Sundar fires in a quicker, shorter ball, that he blocks into the pitch
flat one angling into leg stump, clipped towards short leg
a bit of flight, steps out and clips to long-on from a middle-stumpish line
fullish, angling into middle and off from around the wicket. Defended solidly towards the non-striker
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend into the on side
bouncer in the corridor outside off. Thinks about pulling, but decides in the end to leave
a bit of inward movement and extra bounce, and Bess is stuck on the crease while looking to defend. Past the inside edge to hit him in the groin. Ouch
full, angling down leg. Looks to flick, and gets a tickle of his pad on it to get it past the diving Pant

ooh, nearly another batsman bowled leaving the ball. Ishant gets this to shape back in again, not extravagantly, but it comes in late, after Bess has made his decision to leave. Doesn't miss the top of off by much at all. Inches
big lbw appeal as Bess plays around his front pad while looking to flick. Even fuller this time, big inward movement, probably going down leg

dropped. Bess steps out and looks to flick Washington, but he hits it in the air, and Rohit Sharma puts down a simple one at straight midwicket, coming straight to him at chest height. Came down the track but didn't get his head over the ball, and met it well in front of his body
goes back now to one just back of a length, opens his bat face to steer towards backward point
fullish, angling into off stump from around the wicket, defended back to the bowler
tossed up, a bit of drift in towards off stump, nice stride forward to block it back to Sundar
now he goes on the back foot to one that's not a whole lot shorter, goes with the angle. Defended into the point region
tossed up close to off stump, good stride forward to block into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
length ball, a hint of shape in towards off stump. Presses forward to block into the off side
length ball angling into middle and off, defended to midwicket
full now, swerving into middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and defends it back to the bowler
looks for that full, lbw ball again, and gets his line slightly wrong, too straight. Clipped away to the fine leg boundary
short, angling down leg, left alone
length ball sliding on towards off stump, defended back towards the bowler
down the track now, gets to the pitch of this off-stump ball, and launches it high over mid-off. Doesn't carry all the way, but he still got a good chunk of his bat on it
flatter, angling into leg stump, stays on the back foot to defend into the on side
tossed up on off stump, and he gets a big stretch out to defend back to the bowler
flat one sliding into leg stump, defended to midwicket
length ball, again it skids on towards off stump, no turn. Right behind it to defend back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and stabs it past Rahane diving to his right at gully
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
in the blockhole on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and punches to short cover
length ball on off stump, defends from the crease. This one seems to angle in and then straighten away late. Hits the outside half of the bat and rolls into the gully region
full, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
low full-toss on middle stump, looking for the yorker, clipped towards square leg
length ball, angling into off and middle, clipped watchfully into the leg side
tossed up wider outside off, stretches out to push into the covers
flat length ball angling across to top of off, defended from the crease into the off side
beats the inside edge as Leach stretches out to drive through the covers. Looked like the carrom ball. And a no-ball too.
full on off stump, jabbed into the covers
another carrom ball, spinning in from the rough wide of off stump, a bit of bounce too. presses forward to defend and he's hit on the pad, well outside off stump
goes back to a length ball on off stump, defends down the pitch
full, angling into the stumps, blocked to mid-on

back of a length close to off stump, defends to the right of gully, and declines the single. And another India bowler has overstepped. Wow. Some of these are very close, though. This one certainly was.
back of a length, angling down leg, and Bess misses the flick but gets enough thigh pad on it to beat the diving Pant
length ball, nips in to hit the pad as Bess misses the flick. Missing leg by a long way, though
in the blockhole on off and middle, punched back towards the bowler, who picks it up and flicks it backwards to hit the stumps at his end. Leach hadn't wandered anywhere, though
back of a length close to off stump, punched into the point region
nope. Length ball, angling into off stump, shows the straightest of bats to punch that to mid-on
pushed through outside off, Leach has a short stride and carves the ball to point
tossed up outside off, no turn or drift, driven through the line to mid-off
nice loop from Ashwin, slow, and dips on off, forward and smothered
Bess shuffles forward and across to keep out this full ball on the stumps
Bess forays down the track, is beaten in flight, and smears it to mid-off
floated up and seems to drift away just a shade outside off, Bess opens the face and glides the ball to point
full and just a shade outside off, Leach has a prod at it as the ball bounces through to second slip
near-yorker length delivery, tails in, Bumrah brings with him that exaggerated angle as well. A crease-bound Leach inside-edges onto his pad. 20th no-ball from India
this is an inch-perfect yorker, swerves in, finishes just outside off, Leach hastily jabs his bat down. The ball sneaks under it and goes to Pant
Bumrah drags his length back and shifts his line wide of off, Leach has a crack at it, and ends up inside-edging it behind square on the leg side
shortish and slanting in at the the top of off, Bess gets right behind the line blocks resolutely to cover
pretty full and seemingly reverses to threaten the stumps, pushed to the left of mid-on
much fuller and angling in at off or middle, Bess presses forward and to block another one away
back of a length, drifts in from around the wicket, then spins away a touch, sliced in the air off an outside edge, eluding the hands of silly-point
some turn again for Ashwin, Bess sends an inside edge to the leg side
tossed up on off, not much turn here, Bess dead-bats it away off the front foot
Ashwin drags his length back, gets it to spin in at the stumps, Bess shifts back and secures a single to the right of midwicket
tossed up liberally on leg stump, played back to the bowler
Leach looks for some turn, this Ashwin delivery slides on, poked from off stump towards point
full and largely holds its line outside off, barely carries through to Pant, as Bess ignores it in the channel
beautiful delivery from Bumrah! Good length, angling in towards off stump, so Bess plays for that angle, but the ball straightens away to move past the outside edge
142.4ks yorker, bending into the pads, Bess doesn't quite get hold of the flick. Off the pad ad trickles away through square leg
another Bumrah special. Searing yorker, 142ks, tails in towards the base of middle. Leach somehow keeps it out, having thrusted his front out of the way
mighty full and bends in on middle, jammed towards midwicket once again
Bumrah brings out all his toys with the old ball. This is a benign pitch, but Bumrah runs in hard, hits the pitch harder. Pant leaps to grab this prancing delivery with one hand. Called a wide
short and shoved down the leg side
here comes Bess: down the track, takes on Ashwin, takes on long on. Clears his front leg and clubs it over midwicket with the intended turn
Ashwin drags his length back on middle, Bess stays still in the crease and defends it back to Ashwin
Bess uses his feet again, this time he yorks himself, stabbing the ball out to the man at mid-off
Bess steps out once again, is beaten in flight and by length, he adjusts and quietly pats the ball to short leg
Ashwin finds some turn, worked away to the right of short leg
carrom ball, 77.3ks, Leach has a lot of time to go back and block it into the leg side
full and slanting in on middle, defended
full and homing away outside off, Bess fiddles with it and is beaten on the outside edge

full and skidding in, in addition to sharping angling in from over the wicket, Bumrah traps Bess in the crease. He plays around his front pad in line with around middle and India find some joy with the new ball. The tracker reckons that it would've hit a decent chunk of leg stump
short and slanting in on middle, fended back
wide yorker, Anderson opens the face and jams it to point
short and straightening on middle, Anderson keeps it out
tossed up and drifts in, Anderson defends off the back foot
Ashwin lobs it up, dips on off, Leach rushes down the track and deposits it over mid-on

Pant misses a fairly straightforward stumping chance. Leach shows his ace a bit early, ventures down the track, Ashwin cleverly pulls his length back, gets it to spin and bounce outside off. Perhaps, it was the sharp bounce that defeated Pant

tossed up and dips at off, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Anderson aims a massive slog-sweep, and misses. Pant is now beaten to his right as the ball rolls away into the fence. Replays suggest it was the carrom-ball variation
short and slanting in at off, defended back to Bumrah
darted full on a fourth-stump line, Leach hangs back and pushes it out to mid-off
lifter, sails through to Pant, nothing doing from Leach
rising delivery on off, Leach hangs back ad fends it off to cover
full-toss just a shade outside off, nearly 146ks, driven smoothly, Pujara throws himself to his left from short cover for a sprawling save
short and fizzes outside off, Leach throws his bat at ball...and misses it altogether
flat and fired on off, blocked to cover off the front foot
tossed up slower and higher on off, played back to Ashwin
Anderson dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps, Ashwin held this back, deflected on the bounce to slip
squirted to cover
full and outside off, Anderson reaches out and scythes it down the ground
on a length and drifting down the leg side, Leach can't quite help it away fine
back of a length and slanting in at the top of off, Anderson leans back and drops the ball defensively to the off side
bouncer from around the wicket, the batsman ducks under it belatedly, Pant leaps to his right but the ball bobbles out of his gloves
pitched up and outside off, forward and pushed to mid-off
140.7ks full-toss, bending in at off stump, Leach manages to clip it away to the leg side
short and on off, 140.7ks once again, Leach stays leg-side of the line and defends to cover
another lifter outside off, decent take from Pant this time, as Leach rocks out of the way
Ashwin wraps up England's innings with the third new ball. Tossed up on middle, full, doesn't turn, Anderson stretches out for the slog-sweep, but the ball dips and rattles the stumps
some inswing for Anderson, but he pushes this full ball down the leg side, away from the reach of Rohit
shorter and holds its line outside off, Rohit stands up tall and directs the ball to the left of short cover to get off the mark
back of a length and swinging into the hips, duly picked off to long leg
another inswinger from Anderson, this shapes down leg side as well, going past Rohit's glance
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Rohit is right forward to block it to short cover
nice and full, sliding in at off stump, Rohit shows off his straight bat and defends it back towards Anderson
full and outside off, 135.7ks, no movement in the air or off the seam yet, Gill forward and eases it through the gap at covers
much fuller and swinging into the pads, nicely clipped away between mid-on and midwicket off the front foot
full and Archer cranks it up to 142ks, but the ball still comes quite slow off the pitch, defended back to him
on a length and outside off, no shot
whistles past the outside edge like a quick legcutter. Raises a puff of dust from the Chepauk surface. On a length, Gill plays for the angle, but is bends away past the bat
Archer tests Gill with a 137ks short ball, he swivels and controls a pull, placing it to the right of midwicket for four
more inswing for Anderson, jammed to the leg side via an inside edge
full and on a fourth-stump line, Gill deploys a long stride and blocks it back to Anderson
shot, Gill! Regal on-drive or simply a front-foot push. Pitched up on middle, gets forward and eases it away between Anderson and mid-on
Anderson shifts his line wide of off, Gill respects it and shoulders arms
on a length and angling into a fourth-stump line, blocked back to Anderson
back of a length and skids back in to hit Gill on the thigh as he eyes up the leg side and doesn't make contact
ooh, and he beats the edge again. 142.3kph, jags away from just back of a length in the corridor. Rohit's feet don't really move as he looks to defend this one
too straight, clipped off the pads and he easily beats long leg sprinting to his left

got him, this is sensational bowling from Archer! His first spell of Test cricket in India, and he's already getting so much more out of this surface than India's two very good fast bowlers got with the new ball. Back of a length again, in the corridor, a bit of away movement off the seam, and Rohit plays a defensive push and edges behind. The line was close enough to force him to play, and there was a bit of extra bounce too
back of a length close to off stump, and Pujara is away immediately. Rides the bounce and dabs with soft hands into the cover point region
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended into the cover region
full, a hint of shape into off stump, defended towards mid-on
fullsh, angling into off stump, good stride forward to defend to mid-on
length ball in the corridor, not far outside off but Pujara judges it well and leaves alone
a touch short outside off, gets on his toes to force it away to the right of backward point
full, angling into off stump, gets a stride forward and defends with soft hands towards gully
full again, angling into off stump, and Pujara this time is a little late getting forward. The defensive shot hangs briefly in the air to the right of short mid-on
length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped gently into the midwicket region and they pick up a quick single by the time mid-on sprints there
full on middle and off, and Pujara puts it away beautifully, nice turn of wrists to clip it away through the vacant midwicket region
length ball close to off stump, defended into the cover point regon

ooh, another jaffa from Archer. This one's from a fuller length, very close to off stump, and Pujara, on the front foot to defend, is beaten on the outside edge. Fast legcutter. These are so difficult to play
in the blockhole on middle stump, shows the full face to push to mid-on
full, close to off stump, good stride forward to block to short cover
fullish, angling into off stump, defended solidly towards short mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the cover point region
full, angling into middle and leg, and Gill isn't going to miss out on that. Effortless flick leaves long leg chasing uselessly to his left
full, angling in towards off stump, defended down the pitch and the short mid-on fielder intercepts
a touch too full on off stump, and that is glorious from Gill, gets his head over the ball and clips it away so elegantly through midwicket. Anderson has no one there, just a forward square leg
in the blockhole close to off stump, defended to short mid-on
length ball on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
length ball angling down leg, left alone
fullish, angling into middle and leg, clipped gently into the leg side, and he thinks of a quick single but forward square leg runs in quickly to deny him

nicely played. On a pitch like this, you'll see Pujara playing a lot of these types of shots. Length ball angliing into the stumps, and he lets it come on and closes his bat face slightly upon impact to place the ball wide of leg gully
quick bouncer over off stump, 145.6kph, and Gill keeps his eye on it and ducks quickly out of the way, dropping his wrists swiftly
extra bounce from Archer, from a good length. Angling into off stump or thereabouts, and Gill, on the front foot to defend, fends it away awkwardly into the leg side. Hit him hard on the bottom glove
short to start, up at the front shoulder, pulls it along the ground to long leg
back of a length, angling away from off stump, left alone
back of a length on off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends it back to Stokes
back of a length close to off stump, gets his feet off the ground to ride the bounce and dab the ball into the extra-cover region with soft hands
bouncer over the stumps. Again he's initially in position to hook, but then realises it's bouncing too high, and ducks his head under the ball
short, gets up to chest height on off stump. Pronounced back-and-across step before he pulls along the ground to deep square leg

ohoho, this is just too gorgeous. Full, angling into middle and leg, and yes, most batsmen would put that away to the midwicket boundary, but would anyone else do it as effortlessly? A bit of Mark Waugh in that

gone, and Gill will be filthy with himself for that shot. Full, angling into off stump, and Gill gets forward to drive, plays well in front of his body. It's possible the ball stopped on him, but to me it looked like he played that on-drive a touch too early. Spoons it in the air, and Anderson takes a super catch diving to his left at wide mid-on
back of a length on off stump. Gets right on top of the bounce to defend into the cover point region
bouncer over off stump, keeps his eye on the ball and ducks safely underneath

ooh, that's an awkward short ball, getting up towards Kohli's neck. His bat goes up instinctively to protect himself, and he gloves it into a gap to the right of short leg. It could have gone anywhere
oh wow, another of those quick legcutters, close to off stump. Brings Pujara forward to defend, and beats his outside edge. Imagine Venkatesh Prasad and add 20kph to that
short, angling away from off stump, just above chest high. Pulls, and the fielder at square leg, who's almost right behind the short leg fielder, fumbles it between his legs
short, wide, and Pujara's feet are both off the ground as he cuts this away fiercely to the right of gully
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and picks up another quick single with a soft-hands dab into the covers
bouncer over leg stump, ducks low and evades it
length ball angling across to off stump, and Kohli shuffles across to defend
back of a length on middle stump, hops across and looks to work it square, but can't beat the fielder at short leg
full on leg stump, defended to short leg
short, spinning away slowly from off stump, and Pujara rocks back to punch to deep point. This isn't the field of a team defending nearly 600
length ball on middle and leg, blocked into the on side
back of a length, spinning away from off stump, punched to the right of backward point
shot. Down the track to the flighted ball on leg stump, gets to the pitch of it, and flicks it to the right of the diving midwicket fielder
full on off stump, a bit of flight again, defended back to Leach
full on off stump, clipped towards that deepish mid-on
length ball spinning in from outside off, defended into the on side
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, and whips firmly, but can't beat midwicket, who's stationed quite straight, which is a typical field placement for Pujara
a toiuch short, spinning in from outside off, goes right back in his crease to tuck it gently into the backward square leg region
tossed up outside off, good stretch forward to block into the cover point region
slightly back of a length, and Kohli is back and across to defend in front of off stump
length ball on off stump, defended back down the pitch

length ball outside off, Stokes' version of the legcutter. Pujara pushes at it and is beaten on the outside edge. A rare case of his hands going away from his body. The ball dies before it reaches the keeper, though
length ball on off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended into the cover point region
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
full and just a shade outside off, quietly played to short cover
back of a length and around the fourth-stump channel, Kohli rides it out to gully with soft hands once again
fullish and slanting in at off stump, Kohli opens the face and runs it through the covers
on a length and shifts his lines wider, Kohli gets closer to the pitch and pushes it to point with an open face
a touch too full and straight, driven away to the right of short midwicket for a double
Anderson probes away outside off, Kohli is still patient, dabbing to point
looks like a legcutter rolled out outside off, nothing doing from Pujara
Pujara rides the bounce of this short delivery outside off and steers to gully
pitched up on off, 130ks, tip and run to the covers
full and bending in towards middle and leg, Kohli does not get closer to the pitch and chips a leading edge wide of cover
Pujara presses forward to defensively tap this full ball on off to mid-on
shorter and wider of off, Pujara lets it pass
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, blocked to the off side on the front foot
Kohli hoists his bat above his shoulder and lets this good-length ball go outside off
Kohli covers his off stump and lets another one go outside off. Anderson has shifted his lines wider, but Kohli doesn't bite (yet)
back of a length and slanting in at off, Kohli blocks it into the pitch
Anderson plugs away on off - or outside off - dabbed into the covers with soft hands
back of a length and outside off, Kohli leaves it be
full and hung up outside off, Pujara isn't tempted either
back of a length and Archer brings this back with the angle from over the stumps, blocked on off stump
Pujara jumps back to jab this short ball on a fourth-stump channel to short cover
back of a length and wider of off, no shot from Pujara
pitched up and in the slot from the drive, Pujara takes it from outside off and strokes it straight to short cover
really full on middle, smoothly pushed to mid-on off the front foot
whipped away with the angle to deep midwicket
on a length and a slides on at off, dead-batted away by Pujara
Pujara uses his feet and works it with the spin through midwicket
looped up on off, Kohli lunges forward to smother it
Bess finds some more turn, but the length is too short, allowing Kohli to play it back to him off the back foot
on a length and breaks in at middle, Kohli has ample time to shift back and block it to short leg
prancing delivery from Archer! Leaps from a back of a length, pings the glove as Pujara looses his grip and fends it in the air to the right of Pope at short leg
fuller and slanting into off, forward and clipped neatly to midwicket

ooooh, beats Kohli's outside edge this time. Nice and full, Kohli plays for the incoming angle, but this straightens away late past the outside edge. Kohli wafts and misses. Exceptional bowling from Archer on a flat track
tip and run into the covers
bouncer from Archer, does not rise as much as he would've expected it to, Pujara calmly ducks under it
short and angling into middle, Pujara defends stoutly to the leg side
tossed up just a shade outside off, Kohli presses out and blocks it
back of a length, flat, and skids back in, Kohli blocks off the back foot
on a length and spins back in from outside off, Kohli glides a single square through the off side
Pujara ventures down the track and clips a single with the intended spin through midwicket
floated up just a shade outside off, Kohli lunges forward and keeps it out

nearly chipped into the lap of short midwicket. Turn and dip, Kohli gets forward, but doesn't quite get close enough to the pitch. Checks his shot and it bounces in front of diving short midwicket (Burns)
pretty full and sliding in at off stump, Pujara opens the face and pats it to point
similar line and length, Pujara bunts it to short cover after opening the bat-face
back of a length and holds its line outside off, ignored
full and outside off, Pujara is happy to shelve the drive and let it go
dug in short and outside off, no shot once again
Anderson nails a yorker, bends in at off, Pujara is up to the challenge. Digs it out to cover
good length and spins in on middle, blocked to short leg's left off the back foot
spins in from outside off once again, Kohli goes deep in the crease and defends to short leg's right
very full, comes out as a low full-toss, which is bunted to mid-on's right
sharp spin for Bess from outside off. A crease-bound Pujara is surprised by some extra bounce too. He jumps back and jams an inside edge onto the pad
looped up outside off, down the track and squeezed to mid-on
Pujara ventures down the track again, manufactures a full-toss, and hits it back to Bess, who dives to his right from his followthrough to stop it
on a length and wobbles away just a shade outside off, no shot
on a length and homing in at off, forward and pushed defensively to cover
on a length and Anderson shifts his line wider of off, Kohli shoulders arms wisely
on a length and wobbles away slightly, Kohli ignores it
back of a length and slanting in from wide of the crease, does not threaten off, so Kohli lets it go again
pitched up, Anderson continues to explore the channel outside off. Kohli, however, isn't tempted
looped up and spinning in, defended to short leg
down the track, Pujara gets close enough to the pitch and whips to deep midwicket
pushed through on off, Kohli is forward to work it to short midwicket

some drift, turn and sharp bounce for Bess. Sharper catch at short leg from Pope. Tossed up outside off, dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch of the ball. Kohli has a hard-handed waft at it, the ball turns to graze the inside edge and pops to Pope who lunges to his right. Textbook-style offspinner's dismissal. Huge breakthrough for England
flighted on middle, forward and driven to mid-on
full on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
full and Anderson brings this back into Pujara's pads, picked off through square leg

full and bends back in at off, Rahane plants his front leg and flaps it away through square leg off the glove. Anderson is getting reverse-swing. That reared off the pitch, raising another puff of dust
fullish and slanting in at off, defended off the front foot
pitched up on off, Pujara closes the bat-face a touch and blocks to short midwicket
full and wide of off, no shot
full on off, Pujara replies with a tight front-foot defence
tossed up outside off, Bess finds turn and dip, chipped in the air to the right of Burns at short midwicket
back of a length and sliding into the pads, glanced away behind square

Rooooooot flings himself to his left to pull off a stunning one-handed catch at short cover. Looped up, Rahane steps out to meet a full-toss, but it dips, as Rahane can only scoop it in the air. Root then plucks it out of thin air. Bess has bowled well to pick up two but wickets, but the shot selection hasn't been great from India
tossed up full on middle and off, blocked to short leg
back of a length, spinning towards off stump, defended off the back foot, back to the bowler
shortish, spinning away from off stump, slows down off the pitch, slapped to short extra-cover. He may have been looking to hit that squarer
length ball, angling into leg stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, a bit of swing away from the right-hander. Left alone
good leave. On a good length, close to off stump, but he gets a good stride forward and judges the line perfectly
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into leg stump, clipped to leg gully with soft hands
length ball on middle stump, defended to midwicket
tossed up full on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, not a whole lot of turn, and Pant insouciantly whips it away off the back foot, through square leg
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, doesn't get to the pitch, and he thrusts his pad at the ball with bat hidden behind it. Too much bounce to provoke a proper lbw appeal
quicker, on off stump, presses forward to block to short leg
quickish length ball on off stump, goes back in his crease and defends to midwicket
down the track to the off-stump ball, gets close to the pitch of it and whips to forward square leg
full to start, strays down leg, and Pant clips it away to the fine leg boundary
short and wide, and Pant steps across and slaps it away through cover point. Freed his arms fully, and his bottom hand came off the handle
fullish, angling into the fifth-stump channel, gets forward to push to mid-off. Played a little away from his body there
fullish, angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
full on off stump, jabbed into the covers
full outside off, driven to the right of mid-off
down the track to the off-stump ball, clips it wide of the diving man at short midwicket, but can't beat square midwicket
and again, tossed up on off stump, down the track to whip it to square midwicket
goes back to one that spins in sharply from outside off. Wants to flick, but he's cramped for room, and ends up flicking in the air, but safely in the end, to that man at square midwicket
shuffles out of the crease again, but he isn't to the pitch of this flghted ball wide of off stump. Padded away with bat behind pad
tossed up wider again, and this time Pujara gets right to the pitch of it, and he uses his wrists to drive it firmly to the right of mid-off

and again. Bess bowls this quicker, on an off-stumpish line, and Pujara is out of his crease in a flash to convert it to a full-toss and smack it between bowler and mid-off. A lot of bottom hand in that shot again, typical Pujara
down the track first ball to the flighted ball outsde off, and he lofts it flat, on the bounce, to long-on
down the track to the flighted ball on middle and off, drives inside-out to the left of mid-off
ooh, some extra bounce. Goes on the back foot to try and work it leg side, and inside edges into thigh pad. Falls safely close to his feet, though
bang. Out of his crease to the flighted ball, and he swivels himself through a big slog that easily clears the wide long-on boundary

and again. This time he's slightly less close to the pitch of the ball after jumping out, and so he employs a diagonal-bat swat to just clear Dan Lawrence running to his left from long-on and diving desperately
tossed up closer to off stump, swept along the floor to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, left alone
fuller, on middle and off, gets his front pad out of the way to defend it back towards the bowler
short, wide, slapped to the left of the deep cover sweeper
goes on the back foot now to one that spins in sharply from outside off. Was making room to try and punch it through point, but it spun too much and he had to be content defending it
quickish, spinning into the stumps, goes back and defends into the on side

nicely bowled, dips onto that perfect length close to off stump where Pujara has to try and stretch forward from the crease to defend. A bit of extra bounce, and the ball hits high on the inside edge but dies before reaching short leg. The difference between this and the Kohli one was the line. The wider line drew Kohli's bat away from his body and made him play with an open face

and Pant continues taking Leach on. And why not if he can keep hitting them like that. Tossed up, aiming into the footmarks, and he gets down the track, gets close to the pitch, and swings it away with the turn, over long-on
a bit quicker, spins into the stumps, goes back and works it away through backward square leg
a touch short, spinning away from off stump, waits and wats and then plays that trademark late cut wide of slip
a touch short again, goes back to work it away off his hips to long leg
tossed up full outside off, gets forward and pushes to the right of backward point with an open face
sharp turn, but starts just about wide enough for Pujara to leave it
tossed up full, close to off stump, good stride forward to defend into the off side
full on off stump, driven with an open face to the right of short cover, who makes a diving stop
stays back to a quickish length ball on off stump, punches it back to the bowler
quickish length ball again, a little further outside off, defended into the off side
tossed up wider, opens his bat face and steers it to the left of backward point
slightly short, spinning in from outside off, Pujara rocks back to pull, but it isn't short enough for a full extension of the arms, so he can't get the power behind his shot to beat short midwicket
down the track again, and this time he's just cleared Archer leaping backwards at long-on. Tossed up on that wide-ish line again, and Pant gives it everything, with that big swivel through the hips
quicker, gets a good stride forward to push to the right of extra-cover
tossed up on middle stump, steps out and whips to the right of mid-on
back of a length outside off, lets it come to him and opens his bat face to steer it wide of the diving fielder at slip
nice length, spinning from middle-and-leg to off. Presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
sharp turn and bounce from just outside off, left alone
nicely left. Dangled up invitingly outside off, and he gets a big stride forward and shoulders arms
flatter, on the pads, clipped round the corner to long leg

Do we have a run-out here? Down the track, meets this one on the full, and flicks from outside off, but the man at short leg does brilliantly to stop it and flick it at the stumps. Pujara dives in, but is he home in time? The umpires check  with their colleague upstairs if it's a bump ball first - yeah, it bounced into the ground after hitting the bat, so it's not a catch at short leg. Now they check for the run-out. Nope, he's in the crease just in time. Superb work from Ollie Pope at short leg, though. Direct hit would have probably had him.
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, clips it to short midwicket
quicker, on off stump, goes back to clip to mid-on
tossed up outside off, steps out and clips it between the two midwickets
down the track and Leach fires in a full-toss at his pads, clipped away to the right of backward square leg
a touch short outside off, goes deep in his crease for the late jab to the left of backward point
this time the line is too close to off stump for the late cut. Chops it firmly to backward point
tossed up slower, close to off stump, presses forward and defends with soft hands
down the track, and that's the shot of the innings so far. Right to the pitch of this middle-stump ball to whip it against the turn, to the right of mid-on
tossed up outside off, stretches out and defends with an open face, looking for a single to the left of backward point. The fielder moves quickly and prevents it
first show of aggression from Pant against Bess. Down the track, and he gets close to the pitch to play the inside-out lofted drive over extra-cover. Top shot
quickish length ball outside off, left alone
tossed up slow outside off, and Pant leaves it alone. Sharp turn and bounce again
fuller, closer to off stump, driven to short extra-cover. Reached out a little
quicker length ball outside off, left alone
square turn from outside off, and it's a good thing for Pant that he left this one as well. Excellent take from Buttler, reaching to his left
down the track, and Pujara brings up his fifty with another gorgeous shot off Leach. Skips slightly inside the line to drive inside-out, to the left of extra-cover. Superb feet, superb hands
tossed up outside leg, thrusts his pad out and kicks it away
now he drops a touch short, and Pujara has ample time to make a bit of room and chop to deep point
tossed up wide of off, gets a stride forward, head over the ball, to clip to midwicket

flat-batted, what a way to get to his fifty. Down the track, and this time he's well to the leg-side of this flighted ball from Leach. Hammered flat, straight of mid-off, and it smacked the boundary boards almost before he had completed his follow-through
down the track again, this time he's closer to the line of the ball and he uses his wrists to clip it down to long-on
tossed up wide of off, looks for the cover drive but plays too early. Off the inside half of the bat, back to the bowler
tossed up fuller, on off stump, blocked into the covers
shortish outside off, punched to deep cover
flat length ball on off stump, goes back and looks to work it away but Pope throws himself to his right at short leg to stop it
skips out to the flighted ball outside off, clips it back to the bowler
flatter, goes right back on off stump to defend into the on side
back of a length and slanting in towards the top of off, solidly blocked to cover
much fuller and homing in at off, Pant deploys a big stride and plays it back to Archer
pitched up on middle, Pant moves forward to defensively push the ball to the covers
overpitched and sliding into the pads, tucked away to long leg
pitched up and outside off, Pujara covers his off stump and shoulders arms
full and angling into middle, Pujara is right forward - and across - to blunt it to the leg side
short, wide, sits up to be thrashed. Pant doesn't need any second invitations. He reaches out for the ball with his hands and flays it away to the left of backward point
on a length and sliding in on middle from around the wicket, defended
Pant gets right behind the line of this back-of-a-length delivery on off, defensively drops the ball to cover
floated full and on a fourth-stump channel, Pant gets forward and drives through the line to mid-off
fullish and just a shade outside off, run away to point with soft hands
Pant stands up tall to this short ball outside off and punches powerfully through the line to ping the cover boundary. Top shot from a top player
glorious straight drive. All Pujara has to do is punch the ball, it's a full toss, an attempted yorker gone bad, and the batsman simply presents the straight bat with an added oomph
oooh, he's aggressive! Spots the short ball outside off and rocks back to try and smash it through the covers. Doesn't quite manage it though
goes back to basics with a full length ball outside off and Pujara gives it the respect it deserves: a leave
comes in off the pitch, cramping Pujara on middle and off. But he's solidly behind the short ball rising up above his midriff
keeps low does this length ball outside off. Archer tries to hit the deck on just back of a good length but it dribbles through as Pujara leaves
back of a length and cutting in off the pitch, but straight onto the middle of Pujara's back foot defence

outside edge flies away between slip and gully. There is no doubt Pant was drawn in to play away from his body, but this pitch is so slow, that there is time for the batsman to realise his mistake and soften his hands so that the ball goes to ground
tucks a back of a length ball angled into him towards midwicket

hints of reverse swing into the left-hander, but it's on an overpitched delivery that Pant drives smartly to mid-off. Then not so smartly he wants a single, and he's fortunate Pujara has the clarity and authority to send him back
blocks a good length ball outside off with extremely soft hands in front of point and now they pinch the single on offer
chops a back of a length ball outside off towards gully

decks in sharply on Pujara who takes a hit on the gloves. A painful one by the looks of it. He wrings his right hand immediately and then when he goes up to Pant, the pain forces him to bend over with his hands on his knees. Good stuff from Anderson though. Steady diet outside off stump, then suddenly the sharp back of a length indipper, which gains venom on this pitch which is occasionally offering variable bounce. This one jumped a bit on Pujara, requiring him to call for medical assistance
back of a length on and around off stump, Pant blocks
angles the bouncer into the left-hander, but on a slow pitch, Pant has so much time to get behind it
bouncer, this one a little off target, sliding down leg side. Pant avoids it
the flashing blade of Pant comes down hard against a length ball very wide outside off stump, but he's tried to hit this one too hard. Loses his timing and finds cover
bangs it in, making it rise up to the right armpit of the left-handed batsman. Pant does well to blunt it right by his feet
this comes down from a bit of a round-arm action. A full length ball that Pant drives to mid-off
steps out of his crease to turn a well flighted delivery outside off into a full toss and he drives to mid-on
another trip down the wicket, as he gets to the pitch of the ball outside off, and whips it to midwicket
third shimmy down the pitch in three balls, and here Bess is for it, pulling his length back just a tiny bit and forcing him to block on off stump

and there's how Pujara dominates spin! The threat of a man coming at the bowler makes him bowl too short and this man, this unbelievable batsman, is ready on his back foot, launching a pull shot to the deep square leg boundary
flatter and quicker this time on off stump, Pujara goes back and blocks it

outstanding footwork again as he races down the track, giving the bowler no chance, no hint of doing so before the delivery is bowled, and whips the full ball on the pads to the right of mid-on. He's so quick when he advances out of his crease
defends a good length ball on off stump

short and wide, Pujara calmly taps it through to the cover boundary. There is nothing about this shot that is in anger. All he does is make contact, and find the gap. He is so in control of his game that when the bowler loses even a small fraction of his, he pounces
defends a full ball on middle and off stump
rises with the short ball outside off and deftly knocks it down in front of cover, soft hands, quick single.
bouncer outside off, it's too high for a shot, Pant leaves
bouncer on middle and leg, looking to cramp and maybe even unsettle Pant, but the ball just drifts a little too far, allowing the left-hander to get out of the way
on a length and spinning into middle, glanced to the right of short leg
short and spins away outside off, Pant is right back to crack it to deep cover sweeping the off side
Pujara takes a trip down the track, gets close enough to the pitch, and flicks with the break to midwicket
down the track once again, Pujara has got too close to the pitch this time, but he adjusts and drills a drive to the left of a diving Anderson at short cover
dangled up invitingly on off, Pujara skips out, is beaten in the flight, adjusts once again. Hides the bat behind his pad as the ball rolls towards the covers
on a length and turns back in rather sharply, Pujara goes on the back foot and defends it resolutely to the leg side
banged in short and outside off, Pant can't quite rise on top of it. Chopped away weakly between point and covers
good length and angling into a front-foot push on middle to short midwicket
full and homing in at off stump, Pujara pats it down to mid-on
shorter on off, Pujara allows the ball to come onto the bat, then drops it to the cover-point region and rushes across for a single
full on off, Pant leans into a drive and sends the ball rolling past the bowler
full and outside off, run away to gully, where Burns, I think, makes a tumbling save
flighted and outside off, Pujara uses his feel, meets this offbreak early and nurdles it to midwicket
on a length and just a shade outside off, blocked back to Bess
Pujara uses his feet once again, Bess drags his length back. Pujara hides his bat behind his pad and seemingly kicks it away

oooooh, what have you done Pujara? He slaps his bat against his pad. Bizarre play. Replays indicate that Burns has snaffled it at short midwicket off a rebound from the shoulder of the man ducking at short leg (Pope). Shorter offbreak from Bess, Pujara sees the length and loads up for a pull. The ball may have stopped on him, Pujara pulls firmly and puts short leg in the firing line. He ducks, cops a blow on the shoulder, the ball balloons to Buns
tossed outside off, hint of turn, forward and smothered into the covers
tossed up full at leg stump, whisked away to mid-on
on a length and pushed wide of off, Pant lets it go
on a length and spinning back in, Pant hastily jabs his bat down to keep it out on off
on a length and spins back in once again, Pant is caught in the crease and manages an inside edge onto the pad
Leach targets the rough once again, funky shot from Pant. Drops down to one knee and scoops it in the air between the keeper and leg-slip for four. He continues to dominate Leach
down the track and poked back to the bowler

muscled over long-on for six. Leach tosses it up outside off, Pant dashes down the track, does not get close to the pitch, but the hands and hips manufacture all the power. Swung away towards the deserted stands
flighted on middle stump, Washington bends forward in defence
full-toss just a shade outside off, driven away, Burns, I think, flings to his left at short cover, and deflects it to mid-off
looped up on off, Washington stretches out to smother any spin
slow, short, wide, cracked off the back foot but straight to short cover
flighted on off, Washington deploys a solid stride and defends to silly-point
turn and bounce outside off, Washington judges it well and shoulders arms
tossed up outside off, Pant has to reach out for a scoop/sweep, he loses his balance, and manages to flap it out of the rough over leg-slip
on a length and kicks out of the rough, Washington plays back and somehow keeps it out
shot, Washington! Tossed up outside off, but a bit too full. He stretches out and laces it through the covers to get off the mark in style
back of a length, flat, and spins back in, Washington goes back and turns it defensively to short leg
more spin for Leach from the rough, Washington nurdles it to midwicket
flat and spins in, Washington gets on top of the bounce, head over the ball, working it through square leg in busy fashion
looped up on middle, full-toss, Washington leans into it and offers a mere extension of a push. Put away to the left of Bess through mid-on
fractionally overpitched and outside off, Washington stays leg-side of the line and crunches it to extra-cover
dropped short and wide outside off, Washington is right back to it, cracking it to the right of shortish-point for four
tossed up outside off, driven through the line, but straight to mid-off
on a length and outside off, the off-side infield is packed, but Washington manages to secure a single to deep cover off the front foot
shortish and skidding in on middle, Pant skips back and shovels it away through square leg
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
flat and skidding through outside off, left alone again
flat and spins away outside off, no shot
slider outside off, no shot
pushed through on the stumps, whisked away to the covers
round-arm dart outside off, belted away towards long-off
angles this one down the leg side from around the wicket, and Pant gets down low to sweep firmly to the right of deep backward square leg
tossed up slower and fuller on off stump, defended back to the bowler off the front foot
full on off stump, driven to mid-off

down the track, and Pant has finally miscued a lofted hit. Well bowled by Bess, shifts his line wider and asks him to take on the fielder at deep cover. Does so, doesn't middle it, and slices it into the hands of Leach, coming in a few yards off the rope and moving to his left
tossed up, spinning in towards off stump, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
full on off stump, clipped to mid-on
goes back to one spinning in from outside off, and works it around the corner through backward square leg
fullish, tossed up outside off, left alone
a touch short, goes back to cut towards deep point
tossed up just outside off, big stretch out to defend it back to the bowler
flatter, goes right back to try and work that behind square. There's a backward square leg in place now, no leg gully.
once again, goes deep in his crease to work him with the turn, from the stumps. Backward square leg runs to his right and cuts it off.
nicely flighted outside off, gets it to dip and turn as Ashwin stretches out to defend. Reasonably loud lbw appeal, but that struck him outside the line, I think. Maybe an inside edge too
quickish on off stump, goes back and defends it back towards the bowler
flat again, spins in from outside off, nicely behind it to defend into the off side
well bowled, slower, and the line shifts to middle and leg. Ashwin plays a little around his front pad to defend into the on side
tossed up outside off, big stretch out to get close to the pitch of the ball and smother it
line goes a little wider, and Ashwin gets that big stride forward again to block square on the off side
tossed up wide of off stump, left alone
full outside off, whipped to the right of mid-on
nice length, straightening towards off stump. Presses forward and defends with an open face
sharp turn from just outside off, left alone
full on middle and leg, driven inside-out and short extra-cover dives right to stop it

full on middle stump, and Ashwin plays another smooth inside-out drive that beats extra-cover's dive this time, but mid-off manages to stop it with his left foot. Dangerous technique there, he could have easily stepped on the ball and turned his ankle
flat offbreak spinning into the stumps, defended off the back foot into the on side
nicely flighted outside off, big stride forward to defend back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump, gets right back to defend into the off side
just a touch short, turning towards middle stump, and Ashwin plays a short-arm pull out to deep forward square leg
full, on the pads, clipped to the right of backward square leg. Sundar wants a single, but Ashwin sends him back, and it was pretty close to the fielder anyway
flat offbreak spinning away outside off, deliberately pads it away, and the umpire signals dead ball as the ball races to the third man boundary
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the right of deep point
a touch short again, from over the wicket this time, and Washington goes back and across to work it from his stumps through backward square lehg
turn and bounce outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, defended back down the pitch
nicely played. Goes back to a marginally short ball spinning away from off stump, and steers it to the left of deep point
tossed up wide of off, driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, left alone
ooh, play and miss. Back of a length, and this one nips away like a legcutter in the corridor. Has a little poke at it and misses
back of a length, angling into leg stump, steps across and tucks it away through square leg
length ball angling into the stumps, shuffles across and clips it away to long leg
full, fairly wide of off, driven to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, and a big stretch forward and across to defend into the on side. Hit the inside half of the bat

lands this in the rough wide of off stump, and Washington stretches out to pad it away. Not the biggest appeal from Leach, but England think about it a little longer and review Anil Chaudhary's not-out decision... Ball-tracking is taking a while to load up... We're still waiting... Big stretch out, and it hit him on the thigh pad. Ball-tracking suggests the ball didn't spin enough to hit off stump, and bounced too high as well
tossed up full, wide of off, nice use of the wrists to work this to the right of mid-on
sharp turn from an off-stump line. Good length too, and that's a sharp leave from Ashwin
tossed up fuller, similar line, reaches out slightly to drive with an open face towards backward point
full on middle and off, defended off the front foot into the covers
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball, goes a little wider on the crease to create a bigger inward angle and try and draw a shot from Washington, but he doesn't succeed
full, angling into middle and off, defended to mid-on
short, at Washington's front hip, gets on his toes to tuck it away to long leg
back of a length on off stump, gets right behind it to defend towards mid-on

and again, a huge appeal as Washington stretches out to pad one away. This one seemed to turn further than the previous one.. And England have reviewed again. Oh yeah, it did turn further, but it's bouncing over again, bouncing over the top of off stump
tossed up closer to off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
big puff of dust out of the rough as Sundar goes back and across to defend, manages to play it out into the gully region
full outside off, gets a little too close to the pitch to drive. Jams it to short leg off the inside half of the bat
tossed up wide of off, big stretch forward to defend into the covers
nicely flighted, dips onto a good length outside off. Another big stretch forward to defend, and the ball goes past the inside edge to strike his pad, outside the line of course
sharp bouncer, even though the speedgun says 122kph. Climbing steeply over the stumps, and Ashwin crouches slightly to get under it
full, close to off stump, presses forward to defend into the gully region
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the cover point region
length ball close to off stump, good stride forward to dab it wide of gully with an open face
full, angling into middle stump, clipped to square leg. Was there a bit of inward movement in the air?
glorious. Half-volley outside off, yes, but that was such a flowing, effortless drive to the right of mid-off. Just a smooth push
tossed up full on leg stump, Ashwin plays a checked inside-out drive to short extra-cover
short, spinning away from off stump, plays the late cut but can't beat backward point
back of a length, straightening towards off stump, stands tall and punches through cover point
nicely bowled. Dangled up outside off, and it dips shorter than Sundar expects as he stretches out to defend. Turns past the inside edge to hit thigh pad
fuller now, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
goes back to one that's slightly shorter, and works it off his stumps through backward square leg. He's used this shot very effectively today
full-toss on middle stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
tossed up full on off stump, defended to short cover
nicely flighted, angling into leg stump, gets his front pad out of the way and defends it back to the bowler
another full-toss, on off stump, punched firmly and this time he finds short cover
short outside off, lets it come on and chops it to the right of backward point
goes back to a length ball and defends comfortably in front of off stump

dropped. Difficult chance for Archer, turning around and running back from mid-on. Got both hands to it, but couldn't hold on, after Sundar failed to get close enough to the pitch for one of those no-look slog sweeps
tossed up fuller, stretches out to block it
slower and wider, big stretch out to pad it away
nicely flighted outside off, dips and turns as Washington comes forward to defend. Off the inside half of the bat towards short leg

goes back and across to clip this quickish length ball from just outside off into the square leg region. Sundar sends Ashwin back for some reason. Seemed like an easy single with short leg running chasing a long way back
fuller, on off stump, clipped to mid-on
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, driven towards mid-off
back of a length, spinning in from outside off, looks for the late cut, but he's cramped for room and has to defend into the point region
goes back again, a quicker ball, slightly fuller on a similar line. Dabbed gently into the point region
a touch short, spinning in towards middle and leg, steps across and clips to short leg
sees him step out and bowls it shorter and quicker. Stands tall and punches to midwicket
tossed up full, just outside off, clipped back down the pitch, towards the non-striker
