shot! Tossed up full and wide of off, and he had to reach out to get to the line of the ball, but he gets down on his back knee and uses his wrists beautifully to smack this drive between cover and mid-off, against the turn
a bit of bounce out of the rough, but he's nicely back and across to work it with the turn through square leg
quickish length ball close to off stump, defended with an open face into the point region. A bit of bounce too, that hit the sticker on Ashwin's bat
turn and bounce again, but from wider, and Ashwin leaves it alone
tossed up full on middle and leg, defended inside-out into the covers. Very mindful of not getting his front pad into line
nicely played again. Tossed up on middle and leg, and he gets a big stride out, but places his front foot leg-side of the ball to defend it with the full face into the off side
full, angling down leg, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, close to off stump, defended towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, a bit of extra bounce. Takes his bottom hand off the handle to ensure he keeps it down, playing it back towards the bowler
length ball close to off stump, shuffles across to punch to mid-off
fuller now, slightly wider, defended to cover
bouncer, rising over off stump. Drops his wrists nicely and sways his upper body away from the line
tossed up into the rough, stretches a long way out to try and pad it, but it doesn't turn as much as expected, and Buttler takes it very well behind the stumps
tossed up a bit fuller, big stretch out again to defend into the off side
back of a length now, goes deep in his crease to defend with the turn towards square leg
ooh, nearly! Back of a length again, and this one bounces to hit the bat sticker as he goes back and across to defend. Drops down by his feet and then bounces backwards, over the stumps
wow, that's huuuge turn from outside off, and bounce. Gets back and across, presumably to defend, and the ball zips past his right shoulder and beats Buttler too
back of a length, gets nicely behind it to defend with the turn towards short leg
tossed up and turns into the pads, defensively dropped to the right of short leg
Ashwin gets forward to block this full ball on off stump
more spin for Bess, of the slower variety, blocked on middle stump
slower through the air, on off, Ashwin is right forward to smother it
shorter and sliding into the thigh pad, allows Ashwin to shift back and punch it through the vacant spaces at midwicket
dropped short and attached with width, loose ball, Washington jumps back and crunnnnnnnches it to the right of short cover to get going on day four. Duly put away
dangled up on middle stump, Ashwin opens the face and defensively guides the ball to short cover
sliding into off stump, played back to Leach
flighted and outside off, opens the face and pats it to the left of short cover this time
fired into off stump, pushed back to Leach
on a length, starts around off and spins away, keeps low to beat the outside edge
this seemingly slides in with the arm, threatening off and keeping low. Ashwin keeps it out
after a long-hop from Bess, Washi gets a middle-stump full-toss, which is belted away to the left of Bess and right of Ashwin
looped up into the rough just a shade outside off, blocked off the front foot
pushed through on off, this non-turner is defended back to Bess
shorter and drifts away outside off, Washington gets back and forces a single through the cover-point region
on a length and breaks in on a fourth-stump channel, Ashwin hangs back and runs it away towards point with soft hands

oho, where did this come from? Outta nowhere. Bess loops it up outside off, Ashwin dashes down the track and smokes it over mid-on, hit with the break, for six, drawing applause from the Indian dressing room
flighted and outside off, forward and smothered
short and spinning in on middle and leg, Washington shifts back and glances it through square leg
pushed through just a shade outside off, now it's Ashwin's turn to defend off the front foot
tossed outside off, dips, makes Ashwin reach for the ball and carve it through point
shorter and skidding into the stumps, played back
tossed on middle, Ashwin dead-bats it away
another half-tracker, spins away outside off, Washington goes so deep in the crease and flays it away between short cover and extra-cover for four
pushed through on a fourth-stump line, blocked off the front foot
looped up and drifting into off stump, played back to the bowler
on a length and spins away outside off, Washington goes on the back foot and pats it towards point
overpitched on middle stump, driven to silly mid-on
floaty full-toss on middle, Washington eases a single down to long-on
fractionally overpitched and outside off, classy from Washi! Second half-century in his second Test - and first at his home ground. He flows forward and creams it through the line
Leach aims for the rough outside off, Washington hides his bat behind his pad as he feigns to block
pushed away to the right of mid-on
flighted and just a shade outside off, defended off the front foot
guided to point
full and attacking the stumps, defended back
pitched up and dies on its way to the keeper outside off as Washington ignores it
on a length and wobbles away a bit, nothing doing from Washington
pitched up and swings away outside off, ignored once again
on a length and nips away outside off, Washington shoulders arms
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, homes in, defended
pitched up and outside off, Washington shoulders arms once again
on a length and bends away outside off, Ashwin opens the face and glides it through point
shot, again, Washington. Sure, this is a bit foo full on middle, Washington flows forward once again, head over the ball, dispatched between Archer and Ashwin, beating mid-on
on a length and kicks up from the surface, hits the sticker of the bat, Washington checks his push and defends
back of a length and shoved down the leg side, left alone
short and slanting in on middle and leg, whisked away to mid-on
full and shapes in on middle, Ashwin plays close to his front pad and defends it back to Anderson
Ashwin leans back to this short ball outside off and indulges in an open-faced punch to backward point
back of a length and angling in from outside off, no shot
shortish and outside off, Ashwin gets on top of the bounce and jabs it to short cover
another belting drive, this time from Ashwin. He moves fully forward to a full ball outside off and places it to the left of short cover
back of a length and outside off, forced off the back foot to cover
short and slanting in at off stump, played back to Archer
overpitched and finishes on the pads, stylishly picked off to the right of the leg-side sweeper. Shades of my childhood hero Sadagoppan Ramesh there
pitched up and outside off, squirted to the covers
Sweet as. On a length and outside off, this is NOT half-volley, Ashwin eases forward and drives it through the covers
pitched up and outside off, tapped to the left of mid-on
back of a length and slanting in on middle, blocked to mid-on
full and outside off, angling further away, too wide to draw a stroke from Washington
back of a length and moving away with the angle outside off, no shot once again
good length and probing away outside off, Washington shows good judgement and shoulders arms once again
shorter and angling away outside off, Washington lets it pass
back of a length and angling away outside off, Washington ignores another one in the channel
pitched up on the stumps, Anderson makes Washington play after five leaves outside off, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
fractionally short and on the hips, Ashwin plays a wristy flick to the left of deep midwicket
edged and flies between lone slip and gully! Back of a length, threatens to angle in, but straightens, opening up Ashwin. Hits the edge, but doesn't go to hand
full and straight, Ashwin is right forward to pick it away to the right of mid-on and left of midwicket
on a length and tailing in at off from round the wicket, Archer finds some extra bounce off the deck. Washington yanks his bottom hand off the bat and defends it back to Archer
shorter and on off, blocked off the back foot
bouncer, angling in from wide of the crease, Washington has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
slower through the air, on off, no turn, defended off the front foot

Leach returns and provides England with the breakthrough on the fourth morning. Sharp catch from Buttler, running in, diving forward to snaffle it near the silly-point region. Much quicker than the last ball, drifts in towards off, and Leach finds extra bounce. Ashwin has a hard-handed poke at it after stretching out and going low. The ball seemingly loops off the glove and Buttler's athletic intervention gives Leach and England some joy
fired into the pads
darted on off, kept out
shorter and spins away outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover
Leach finds more turn with the new ball, Nadeem pokes it away past slip
full and outside off, possibly a cutter, shoots through to keeper, who stops with his pads. Left alone
heavy-length delivery, outside off, Washington hops and stabs it away between point and covers
short and slanting in at the top of off, fended back to the bowler
short and outside off, Washington leans back and punches crisply, but can't get it past point
cracker from Archer! Full from around the wicket, cuts away, as Washington plays for the angle and is beaten on the outside edge
full on the stumps, Washington wants the single, wants the strike, so he tips it to mid-on and scampers across to the other end. A direct hit could've landed him in trouble
Archer aims for the yorker, but shoves it down the leg side, away from the reach of Nadeem's glance
tossed up full outside off, clipped towards midwicket
looped up wider outside off, big stretch out to pad it away. Pitching too wide and not spinning enough to bring lbw into play
fuller and quicker outside off, defended into the covers
steps out now, gets to the pitch of the ball, pitchng just outside off, and clips down to long-on
flat length ball close to off stump, gets on the back foot to defend into the off side
full on middle stump, driven back down the pitch, towards the non-striker
back of a length outside off, and that's nicely done, opens his bat face and steers it to the right of the diving gully fielder
bouncer climbing over off stump, squats down low to get under it

edged, but falls well short of slip. Length ball close to off stump, and Sundar is half forward to try and push into the off side with a slightly open face. Lost quite a bit of pace off the pitch, raising a puff of dust as well
back of a length, close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs towards gully
bouncer, angling down leg, gets into that squatting crouch again and lets it pass behind his back
short, angling down leg. Hops across, can't connect with the flick off the hip
tossed up, drops onto a nice length on middle and leg, defended into the covers, with the spin
tossed up on off stump, defended into the cover point region
sharp turn and bounce outside off as Nadeem leaves a tossed-up length ball alone
fuller, angling into middle and leg, defended into the on side

got him, nice low catch at slip. Goes back to a length ball that spins away from off stump and bounces steeply. Looks to defend, and the ball hits the shoulder of the bat and goes down low to slip, where Stokes catches it with both hands, inches off the ground
nice long stride forward to defend this flat one angling into off stump
back of a length close to off stump, defended with an open face to gully
length ball fairly wide of off, and Sundar has a big swish at it and misses. Went for the big drive over the covers without really moving his feet
ooh, beauty. Anderson's finding some movement with this newish ball. Length ball angling into the corridor, then hitting the seam and nipping away to beat the forward defensive
beaten three times in a row. This one's fuller and wider, and again Sundar looks for the cover drive without moving his feet

beaten again, or did he just play inside the line and allow it to go past? Possibly the latter. Length ball angling into the corridor, and Sundar looks to defend, but ensures his hands don't get drawn away from his body by the movement

wow, what a magnificent hit. He's been beaten multiple times, but he tells the bowler that doesn't matter as long as he's still at the crease. Full ball angling into off stump, and he just extends his arms through a drive back over the bowler, and clears the boundary effortlessly. Glorious timing
tossed up full on middle and leg, big stride forward to smother the spin
similar length, the line is slightly outside off, good stride forward again to block it back to the bowler

shot. Ishant has brought the sweep into his game in a big way over the last couple of years, and he stretches out a long way, plants his front leg slightly leg side of the ball, and sweeps it from outside off, past the left shoulder of the short leg fielder
fuller outside off, blocked to silly point
back of a length, turning away outside off, left alone
full on off stump, or a good-length ball that Ishant has got to the pitch of thanks to his long stride. Either way, defended solidly to silly point
length ball close to off stump, and that's gorgeous timing again, punched to the left of deep cover point. He takes the single
back of a length on off stump, gets a little squared up as he squirts this defensive shot to gully off the outside edge. All along the ground, though
length ball on middle stump, shuffles across to clip to midwicket
length ball, a bit of inward movement from an off-stump line. Keeps his front pad out of the way and blocks it back to the bowler

brilliant bowling. He's not as quick as Archer, but he can direct his bouncer just as well to a lower-order batsman. Cross-seam, gets it up to neck height, and Ishant fends awkwardly at it and pops a simple catch to short leg
length ball close to off stump, defended into the point region
tossed up wide of off stump, and Sundar has smashed that. Gets down on his back knee and finds the gap to the left of deep cover with his lofted drive

once again wide of off, but slower this time. Reaches out to drive, plays too early, and the ball rolls towards deep square leg off the inside edge. They manage to sneak two runs so Sundar keeps the strike
bang. Root brings his line a little closer to off stump and Sundar lofts this cleanly down the ground, well to the left of long-off
nicely played. Quicker and fuller, wide of off. Has to adjust with his feet to play a Lara-style back-foot cut to the too-full ball. Can't beat backward point, though
sharp turn and bounce outside off. Thinks of cutting, decides against it and leaves
full on off stump, clips it gently into the on side, and they quickly sneak a single to keep Sundar on strike, with midwicket having to rush in quite a distance
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
length ball on off stump, makes room and slashes it out to deep point. Takes the single, giving Bumrah two balls to face

edged, and Stokes has ended the innings with a sensational low catch! Full, angling into the fourth-stump channel. Bumrah pushes at it with the footwork of a genuine No. 11, and it straightens to take a thick edge. Stokes dives to his right at first slip and takes it one-handed, plucking it a fraction of a second before it would have bounced into the turf

and he gets Burns first ball! Perfect delivery to start, angling in and hitting a good length just outside off. Draws Burns forward to defend, and there's turn and bounce to get the shoulder of the bat, and Rahane takes a sharp catch because it was travelling quickly
full carrom ball on off stump, blocked into the off side
length ball turning in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
a bit of bounce as this turns in from outside off, gets on top of it to keep it down into the backward square leg region
sharp turn, but down the leg side, as Lawrence gets forward and misses the flick

ooh, nearly a catch at short leg. Or just overexcitement from India's keeper and fielders. Back of a length, looks to flick it from just outside off, and the ball bounces just short of Gill at short leg
tossed up outside off, left alone, and already there's some sharp turn and bounce on view
full on middle and leg, defended into the on side
huge appeal from Pant, excellent take above his right shoulder, but there's no edge. Draws Sibley to defend a ball pitched just outside off, and it rips away and beats his edge
flat, on a fullish length around off stump, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, punched firmly but straight into silly point's shinpad. And Nadeem has overstepped
tossed up close to off stump, stretches out to block towards silly point
flat length ball spinning away sharply outside off, left alone
tossed outside off, Lawrence steps out right away and flicks it sweetly between midwicket and mid-on with the intended spin
quicker offbreak from Ashwin, full, skids in. Lawrence plays back is rapped on the back pad. But this seems to be heading down leg
on a length and spins in on off, defended back down the pitch
Lawrence gets across to defend this full ball to the leg side
on a length and rips back in from outside off to cramp Lawrence for room. Beats his cut, and just about bounces over the stumps
near-yorker length delivery on off, dug out back to Ashwin
pushed through outside off, holds its line, left alone
Sibley stretches out to push this full ball straight of mid-off. He scampers across for a single and opens his account in the second dig
the new ball slides in at off stump, poked into the leg side off the front foot
shortish and spins away outside off, chopped to point off the back foot
Lawrence uses his feet and drives against the spin to the right of mid-on
lobbed up outside off, spins away, Sibley closes is bat-face a touch and wafts it towards cover
on a length and sliding in at off, Sibley ventures forward and across to bock to the leg side
knocked away to the right of short leg via an inside edge
on a length and spins in at off again, Sibley blocks to short leg off the front foot
much fuller and outside off, forward and clipped out to short midwicket
Sibley shuffles across off and clips with the spin through square leg

tossed-up offbreak from Ashwin, dips sharply even as Lawrence advances at it. Ashwin creates distance between the bat and pitch of the ball, and pings the pad. Lawerence aims for the leg side and misses it altogether
slower through the air on off, Sibley stretches out to smother any spin
flighted on middle stump, another non-turner is negotiated off the front foot
dragged down outside off, Sibley latches onto the width and length, belting it away to the left of short cover. Cut away firmly off the back foot
tossed up liberally and dips at off, draws an inside-edged prod to the leg side
turn for Nadeem, but the length is too short, allowing the batsman to go back and jab it wide of cover
pushed through on off stump, blocked carefully off the front foot
back of a length and spins in at off, punched back to Ashwin off the back foot
tossed-up offbreak, defended back to the right of him
shorter and just a shade outside off, forced off the back foot to short midwicket
Sibley gets forward and across to secure a single through square leg

Ashwin goes up for a big leg-before appeal, not given. With just about a second left on the timer, Kohli calls for a review of the on-field not-out decision. Impact seems to be outside the line. Flighted nicely, turns in, dips. Lawrence has a short stride and is not close to the pitch of this delivery. Ashwin pins the front pad below the knee-roll. No inside edge involved, but yes the impact is outside off. Umpire Chaudhary's on-field not-out call stays
Ashwin flicks out a carrom ball, getting it to swerve away and catch the outside edge. Sliced wide of point
on a length on off, Sibley deploys a big stride to dead-bat it away
darted short and outside off, chopped away to the right of Washington at point. 'Wash! Wash!' is the cry from Pant, but a little misfield allows an easy single in the end
tossed up at off stump, defended off the front foot
speared at off stump, blocked to short midwicket
on a length and sliding into middle, 91ks, played back to Nadeem
looped up on off, Sibley is right forward to keep that out
Sibley shuffles forward and across to calmly defend this length ball on middle
slid through on off, prodded to cover
Lawrence jumps across off and sweeps a single towards deep square leg
flat, shorter and spinning in, defended off the back foot to short leg
shorter and sliding in, Lawrence goes back to keep it out
Lawerence shuffles across off, meets a short ball, gets on top of the bounce and glances a single through square leg
pushed across off, run away to point
big turn and bounce for Nadeem. Quicker through the air, kicks away past the attempted cut, Pant rides the bounce and gathers the ball cleanly
short and spins away outside off, scythed to sweeper cover
pushed through outside off and spins away, carved towards point
run away square through the off side again
tossed outside off, driven through the line to the left of mid-off off the front foot
speared wide of off, nothing doing from Sibley
dangled up invitingly outside off, not much turn, but sharp dip, making the batsman reach for the ball. Sibley drives and is beaten on the outside edge
full and straightens on middle from around the wicket, driven to short midwicket off the front foot
pushed across off, worked to short midwicket off the front foot
fuller on middle, forward and jabbed back to Ashwin
on a length and sliding across off, tip and run to cover
flatter and fired on leg stump, Sibley drops on his knee and sweeps it away to the left of Pujara at leg-slip. Silverwood enjoyed that, applauding from the dressing room

Looped to Pujara at leg-slip this time. Ashwin tosses this up on middle from around the wicket, straightens, turns, and bounces to find the inside edge to loop to leg slip. Two wickets for Ashwin with the new ball. Silverwood didn't quite enjoy that for sure
pushed through on off, defended off the front foot
short and darted outside off, slashed away to the left of sweeper cover
short and outside off, lashed away to cover off the back foot
that's a Root special. Tossed up outside off, Root stretches out to take it on the full. Rolls his wrists and sweeps it flat and hard through square leg
pushed through outside off, forward and dinks it to point with an open face
swept on line once again. Pushed through outside off, Root stretches out once again and hauls it away powerfully to the midwicket fence
full and angling across off, defended
short and sliding across off, beats Lawrence's back-foot slash
fired on off stump, defended into the pitch
Lawrence goes back and across to defend this length ball on the stumps
much fuller on middle, bunted down to long-on
down the track and punched to Washington at long-on for one
nice and full, Ishant finds some inward movement, chipped in the air, but does not carry to catching midwicket
full and straight, picked off to deep midwicket
on a length and just a shade outside off, stabbed to mid-on off the inner half of the bat
back of a length and on a fifth-stump line, stabbed to mid-on off the inside half again
on a length and just a shade outside off, Lawrence swishes his bat out of the way and lets it go
pushed to the left of mid-off to close out the over
flighted and spins in towards off, swept flat and hard to deep square leg
tossed up, full on middle, pumped over the midwicket boundary. He drops to his knee and middles another sweep to the left of deep square
flat and Ashwin pulls his length back a bit on middle, blocked off the front foot
shorter and sliding across off, Root goes right back and punches it towards sweeper cover. Nadeem runs back and hunts the ball down
on a length and angling across off, run away square through the off side
floated up outside off, Root lines up the wider line with another sweep. He shuffles across and drills it up and over backward square leg to move swiftly to 21* off 11 balls
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, nicely punched through the line to cover
attempted short ball from Ishant, doesn't bounce much, Lawrence ducks

Test wicket no. 300 for Ishant - the third Indian pacer to the mark after Kapil Dev and Zaheer Khan. Nice and full, swerves back in at off to sneak under the toe of the bat and smack the front pad below the knee-roll. No inside edge involved. It would've cannoned into middle stump, according to ball-tracking. Lawrence's review goes in vain. That seemed pretty plumb. Big moment for Ishant who is arguably the most improved Test-match pacer in the recent past
full and angling into middle from around the wicket, Stokes covers the line and defends solidly
back of a length and sliding down leg, no shot
on a length and kicks up off the deck, Stokes sways his upper body out of the way
on a length and wide of off, Root toys with the spinners. Rolls out a reverse-sweep and gets it past slip for four
tossed on middle, Root bends forward to dab the ball to the leg side
skidding into off stump, Root goes back and clips it through backward square leg
tossed up on off, hint of turn for Ashwin, prodded to short cover
yorker, drifts in at middle, dug back towards the bowler
glanced off the hips through backward square leg
back of a length, angling into the stumps, gets back and across and works it into the square leg region
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and steers to third man
full, angling into off stump, defended back down the pitch

shot. Full, angling into middle and off, and he just extends his arms through a straight drive to loft it flat, to the right of mid-on. Looks like the slower ball, and Stokes picked it up very quickly
length ball outside off, punched to the squarer of the two covers
full, angling into middle and leg, shows the full face to drive to the right of Rahane at mid-on
number three for Ashwin. Tossed up outside off, drops just short of a driving length and spins away. Drives away from his body, looking to go through the covers, and gets a thin edge through to Pant
down the track, doesn't reach the pitch of this off-stump ball, and flicks airily, just to the right of Gill at short leg
tossed up just outside off, swept to backward square leg
quick length ball on middle and off, straightens, looks like the carrom ball, hurriedly defends from the crease
down the track, can't reach the pitch of this dipping ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, swept to deep square leg
fullish outside off, driven with a twirl of the wrists, to the right of the fielder at cover point. Excellent shot
in the blockhole on middle and off, clipped to the left of deep square leg
full, a bit of swing into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full, angling into the pads, clipped to the middle of the row of three leg-side catchers
full, a bit of late inswing towards off stump, punched to mid-off
full, this one seems to straighten late in the air towards middle and off. Keeps his eye on it and defends into the midwicket region, from deep in his crease

given, and Pope reviews instantly. Looks for the reverse-sweep, and there's a puff of dust and the ball pops up in the air to short leg. Looks like it's off the forearm, but did it flick the bat or gloves on the way? Doesn't look like it. They check for lbw as well, and the ball is shown to be bouncing well over the stumps
carrom ball on middle and leg, defended to short leg. And the no-ball siren goes off again

down the track now, and Pope launches it high in the air, with the turn. Doesn't really get hold of it, and it seems to go off the inside half of the bat, but it falls in no-man's land to the left of deep midwicket. Sundar does well to keep it in with a diving pullback at the rope
tossed up full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full on off stump, reverse-paddled to the left of third man
floated up full on middle stump, and now Pope reverse-sweeps to the right of Bumrah at backward point. Gives chase, tries to pull it back with his heel, and nearly steps on the ball
looks to reverse-sweep from a leg-stump line, and tjhe ball pops up off the back of his bat, but falls well short of Ashwin rushing in off his follow-through
a bit of bounce and inward movement from a length, going down leg. Looks to clip it away, and gets a little edge on it that beats Pant's dive to his left. And it's another no ball. Off Root's glove
length ball outside off, a bit of late shape in, left alone

big appeal for lbw as Root plays slightly outside the line in defence. Not given, and Bumrah is convinced it should be reviewed. India go for it... There's no bat, and Root is playing from the crease. Strikes him in line, above the knee roll, and that's usually a sign that it's bouncing over the stumps. That's what ball-tracking says too, bouncing over and missing leg stump as well.
back of a length outside off, chopped into the gully region
back of a length, a bit wider, and that's punched away gleefully through the vacant point region. With the inswing he's getting, the leg side is heavily protected so there was no one in that area
ooh, back of a length in the corridor, and he gets it to spring off the surface and nip away from Root too. Pokes at it, and the ball zips past his edge and Pant collects over his right shoulder

beats him again. Fuller this time, and perhaps a slower legcutter in the corridor. Root's feet are rooted to the crease as he pokes at this, and the ball zips past his edge but dies before it reaches the keeper
steps out, and is defeated by dip. Plays a checked flick, and the ball loops up but falls just short of Kohli diving forward at short midwicket
quicker on off stump, presses forward and blocks
extra bounce as this spins in from outside off. Gets forward to defend, and the ball hits his glove and falls short of Gill diving forward from short leg
goes back to a shorter one close to off stump and taps it into the point region
beautifully bowled. Now Root is beaten in the air as he jumps out and looks to drive down the ground. Dips, spins, and it's past his bat to hit his pad
goes back to this one pitching outside off, and the turn is slow, so he can watch it onto his bat and steer it wide of slip
back of a length, straightening towards off stump, steered towards deep point
looks for the yorker, middle and leg, gets his front leg out of the way and flicks to midwicket
length ball, some inward movement towards the stumps, clipped in the air, but wide of Rohit diving to his left from square catching midwicket
full, a touch too straight, clipped off the pads to the right of deep square leg. That brings up England's 100

appeal for lbw, immediately given. Nothing Root could do about it, and India's celebrations are muted because, though it's a big wicket, the ball kept low, and that's not a good sign going into the fourth innings. Back of a length, sneaks through low to strike Root's back leg at about shin height as he looks to defend this, right in line with off stump. Okay, maybe it didn't keep that low. Just caught the replay, and the ball came back in sharply, and it hit him on the knee roll
ooh, looks for the off-stump yorker, and Buttller jabs at it, looking to push into the covers. Ends up hitting his inside edge and flying down to the fine leg boundary
tossed up quite full on middle and off, big stretch out to defend
a touch short, spinning away from middle stump, makes room and cuts it away towards deep point
tossed up slow, pitching just outside leg, clipped watchfully into the on side

down the track, and Buttler's shown his intentions very clearly. Gets slightly leg side of the ball to make swinging room, and launches it way over the long-on boundary. And Nadeem's overstepped again, by a distance
quicker length ball spinning away from off stump, defended with an open face towards backward point
goes back to one that goes with the arm towards off stump, but it's short enough, and the pitch is slow enough, for him to be able to punch that neatly through point
flat length ball angling into middle and leg, stays leg-side of the ball to defend to silly point
full, angling into the stumps, clipped between the two short midwickets, and deep square leg runs around to mop up

big appeal from Bumrah as he skids one through from just back of a length and strikes the pad again with the batsman trapped on the crease. This one may have done too much, and be going down leg possibly. No review from India. This one hit the front pad, and was definitely going down leg
back of a length on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped in the air, but again it eludes Rohit diving to his left. So many balls have flown wide of fielders or dropped short of them in this innings
well bowled, well played. This one threatens to come in, then leaves the batsman from a good length just outside off. Wisely elects to leave it
full, close to off stump, punched firmly but can't beat cover
back of a length outside off, goes deep in his crease to chop it away through backward point
shortish, a bit of away movement outside off, chopped into the point region
again Ishant gets it to reverse away from the right-hander. This is really skillful. Length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, closer to off stump, but Buttler picks the away reverse and leaves well
a little fuller now, and this one swings in towards leg stump. Very well played by Buttler, stays leg-side of the ball, keeps his front leg out of the way, and defends into the off side
full, swinging in towards off stump, blocked to cover
wide half-volley, Pope reaches out for it and sends it clattering through extra-cover. Sure, Bumrah erred with his length, but this was stylishly put away to the left of short cover
back of a length and angling in at the top of off, quietly blocked to short cover
full and slanting in on middle, nudged to the straighter of the twin short midwickets
full and largely holds its line outside off, dinked to the left of short cover
jabbed straight to short cover this time
nice and full, homing in at the fourth-stump line, Pope is forward to tap it to short cover
short and drifting on leg stump - or even outside the leg stump - Buttler splices a pull to long leg
reverse-swept from leg stump fine of deep third man
tossed up outside leg, Pope is ready with his reverse-sweep. Picks it from the rough and swats it away through the covers

Pope searches for another reverse-sweep out of the rough, this time he holes out to Rohit at cover. Pushed through flatter and faster outside leg, Pope drops to his knee, but can only get it as far as Rohit as Nadeem finds a bit of extra bounce
Bess shimmies out and chips Nadeem over Ashwin at mid-on
wide of the crease, sliding into the pads, nurdled through the square-leg region
full, threatens to angle in at off, but nips away past the outside edge
full on off stump, pushed to mid-off
full-toss, tailing in at off, jabbed back to the left of Bumrah
back of a length and bending in, Bess can't quite get bat onto the flick, kisses the thigh and rolls away towards midwicket
back of a length and angling into a neat little clip to deep midwicket
full and sliding in at middle, keeps a bit low, played back to the bowler
starts outside leg, so Bess is more than happy to kick it away with his pad
fired outside leg, picked from the rough and glanced to square leg
pitches outside leg once again, Bess pads it away
speared into the rough, padded away to the off side
darted outside leg, kicked away with the pad towards midwicket
flatter and aimed at the rough, padded away again to close out the over
back of a length and slanting in at off, Buttler rides the bounce and secures a single towards sweeper
really full and swerving in on middle, Bess gets forward and across in defence
Bumrah tests Bess with a lifter outside off, Bess half-ducks out of the way having dropped his hands
inswinging yorker, jammed out on middle stump
rears up from a back of a length and strikes Bess on the thigh pad after moving in
pretty full and homing in on the stumps, Bess shows the full face of the bat and taps it to mid-on
darted onto the rough outside leg, Buttler goes low, swatting a sweep and finding short leg
another sweep out of the rough, this time struck flat and hard to the right of deep square leg
dangled up outside leg, Bess looks to kick it away with his pad, the ball misses the pad, beats Pant as well and rolls away past him
down the track and chipped in the air to the right of the leg umpire
swept from outside leg to short fine leg where Bumrah runs around to his left to collect the ball cleanly
nearly a full-toss sliding down the leg side, another sweep attempted (and missed), the ball eventually bounces out of Pant's gloves
poked past slip towards third man. Washington runs around, slides, and seems to have hauled the ball in
full and floated into the pads, clipped to the right of the two short midwickets, but there's protection in the outfield
full and straightens past the outside edge as Bess hangs his bat out in the channel
whipped in the air towards deep midwicket
jabbed to square leg via an inside edge
very full and snaking down the leg side, Buttler can't put bat on ball
tosses it on the rough and finds some turn and bounce, padded away
Nadeem keeps targetting the rough, England keep padding it away
on a length and drifting into the pads, picked off to long leg for a double
tossed outside leg, left alone by Bess
fired into the footmarks, left alone, Bess takes a glancing blow on his back
Nadeem gets one to straighten out of the rough, dead-batted away
steers a back of a length ball outside off to the sweeper
full on off stump, defends stoutly
full and swinging into the right-hander, Bess tries to flick it fine, isn't able to
reverse into the right-hander, but it's not quite threatening enough to uproot Bess.
jams a straight bat down on a very full reverse swinging delivery on off stump and gets a single to the left of mid-on
defends a full delivery on middle stump
steps out to block a good length ball a shade outside off stump
sharp turn from well outside off stump as Bess stays back, perhaps attempting to cut the ball, but then, because of how much it rags, he has to block it instead
nudges a full ball on leg stump to short midwicket
stretches forward to defend a flighted ball on off stump
sweeps it away to deep midwicket
goes for the sweep does Buttler, but this good length ball spins and bounces sharply above his bat and goes through to the keeper, who has some trouble bringing it down too
lets go a good length ball outside off stump
goes back to block a good length ball on middle

missed stumping as the ball turns and bounces way too much for both Bess and Pant. This is fairly full and fairly straight. Bess runs down at it. He doesn't get the pitch. He swings wildly. He misses. The turn and bounce then completely does the keeper in too, the ball flying past Pant's chest, to his right
full on off stump, he defends with an open face, looking for a single behind point. No luck
turns it towards midwicket
pushes the ball into the covers
backs away and cuts a short ball on middle to the sweeper boundary
goes back to defend a good length ball on middle
loops it up just outside off, Buttler stretches forward to defend
blocks a full ball on middle
goes around the wicket for a full ball on middle, Buttler keeps it out
appeal for lbw as Ashwin continues around the wicket. Buttler sweeps a good length ball pitching potentially in line with the stumps, but perhaps the bounce might have been a problem.
another appeal for lbw as Buttler plays around his front pad to a very full delivery on middle and off stump. Inside edged it, I think
Nadeem drags another short ball outside off, Bess rocks back and thrashes it through the covers
on a length and spins away outside off, opens the face and guides it towards short third man
pushed through outside off, more positive intent from Bess. He goes low and smites it over midwicket. Slog-swept away to push the lead past 400
bounces out of the rough, Bess looks to kick it away, and ends up wearing it on his elbow
tossed outside leg, padded to leg-slip
on a length and straightens, blocked on middle and leg
slid through from round the wicket, Ashwin drags his length back after seeing Buttler step out, loops off the pad to short leg
worked to the right of short leg, the ball bursts out of the hands of that fielder
skidding just a shade outside off, Bess stoops low to jab it to the leg side
slow, short, wide. Bess has ample time to shift back and rifle a cut square through the off side for four
tossed-up offbreak, Bess goes for a slog-sweep and may have got an inside-edge onto the thigh pad. No silly-point, just a short-leg in place
down the track ad whipped to short midwicket
pushed through on the footmarks outside leg, Buttler can't get hold of the sweep and instead wears it on his pad

Buttler dashes down the track, Nadeem drags his length back from left-arm over and finds some turn and bounce. Buttler has a roundhouse swipe to the leg side...and misses. Pant nicely collects the ball over the stumps and takes the bails off. Second wicket for Nadeem this innings
back of a length, spinning from leg to off, goes back to punch towards mid-off
turn from the rough outside leg, and Archer closes his bat face, looking for the flick, and the ball pops just out of reach of the second slip fielder diving to his right, off the leading edge
flighted again outside leg, and Archer sweeps to deep square leg
tossed up, spinning into the stumps from outside leg, defended back to the bowler from the crease. Exposed his stumps while doing so

lbw playing back to one that skids on quickly off the pitch while spinning back into him. Hit on the back leg. Given out by Anil Chaudhary, and Bess has reviewed... Close, this. The bat gets jammed behind the flap of the back pad as it comes down to defend, and it's hard to say whether the ball hit the flap of the pad first or the bat. Definitely hit both. Pad first is the verdict after a look at ultra edge, and the ball strikes him in line with off stump and is hitting middle stump according to ball tracking. Fourth wicket for Ashwin
carrom ball, comes in from a length outside off, watches it well and defends from the crease
goes on straight from just outside off, towards the stumps, defended from the crease into the off side
a bit fuller, more leg-stumpish, squeezes it out into the off side in defence
this one turns, and finds the edge as Leach defends from a half-forward press, but it falls short of Rahane diving left at slip
skidder, going towards middle and leg, defended into the on side from the crease
hangs back to one that spins across him from outside leg, punches to deep point
tossed up fairly full outside off, gets close to the pitch and defends into the on side
down the track, and Leach picks up a boundary with a big slog. Possibly wanted to go straighter, but it ended up finding the gap to the right of deep midwicket
goes back and this one jumps at him from the rough. Looks to work it leg side, and the ball hits inside edge, then thigh pad, and falls short of Rohit at short leg
comes out of his crease and jams his bat down as he gets too close to the pitch of the ball
down the track again and has a big slog at a flighted ball wide of off stump. This time he edges it thickly and it flies over the man at slip
length ball spinning in towards middle stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up outside off, whipped to long-on, was in the air for a while but safely so
sharp turn, beats the outside edge. Quickish length ball from around the wicket, pitching just outside off, and Leach is a little late getting forward to defend
once again, a little quicker, defended into the covers
tossed up slower on middle and leg, gets his front pad out of the way to defend with an open face, square on the off side
tossed up quite full, slides on towards off stump, defended off the front foot towards silly point
full, on middle and off, jabbed to extra-cover
flat, speared in towards leg stump, not too much turn. Goes back to work it through midwicket
tossed up full on middle stump, defended into the extra-cover region
tossed up wider and not as full, left alone
full on off stump, punched to extra-cover
quicker, slides on towards leg stump, goes back to tuck it behind square
five! Quick, just back of a length, and it spins in a long way from outside off stump to bowl Archer, whose feet have moved nowhere and whose bat comes down too late to keep the ball out
full, just outside off, and Anderson brings out the reverse-sweep! Into the ground, and it bounces up to Rahane at slip

and that is that. Ashwin ends up with a six-fer. Angled into the stumps, hits that length where the No. 11, not really fully forward, looks to play the angle with a closed face. Leading edge balloons straight back to the bowler, and India will need 420 to win this.
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
back of a length, a little wider, Rohit leaves again
fuller now, but still quite wide of off stump, Rohit leaves again
length ball, a little closer to off stump, Rohit leaves once more
short now, just outside off, and it keeps climbing and climbing until Buttler jumps and plucks it out from over his head. Rohit looked to hook it, but it bounced far too much for him to make contact
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-off
quickish, just outside off, goes back to defend to short extra-cover
tossed up, angling in and pitching just outside off. Sharp turn from there after Gill leaves it alone
leaves again, this one's quicker and a bit shorter
fuller on off stump, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
down the track, gets a little too close to the pitch of this off-stump ball, jams it into his front leg off the inside half of the bat while looking to drive

shot! That's a pretty good ball, sliding on into the stumps. To most other batsmen, that's a good length too, but he's gone right back onto his stumps to whip it away to the left of the short leg fielder
back of a length outside off, left alone

back of a length, closer to off stump now and he gets some extra bounce. Rohit hops to defend it, and the ball hits the sticker of his bat. Does well to play close to his body and keep it down by his feet
length ball outside off, left alone. Given Archer's pace, he didn't really get on the front foot to leave this one even though it was on the fuller side of a length
short and wide, and Rohit shapes to cut but the ball keeps low and sneaks under his bat before dying on its way to the keeper. Raised a big puff of dust too
full angling into off stump, presses forward to block into the covers
length ball close to off stump, Rohit gets across to cover his off stump and leave it alone
tossed up full on off stump, blocked in the direction of mid-off

shot. Superb shot. Goes on the back foot to a length ball sliding on towards middle and leg, and punches with a straight bat wide of mid-on. Very few batsmen can play in that direction with a straight bat line that
full, angling slightly down leg, and that's a poor ball when you've just moved your fielder away from backward square leg. That's where Gill flicks this
back of a length fairly wide of off stump, left alone
tossed up full on off stump, nice easy stride forward to block to short cover
full on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and stabs to the right of backward point
shortish, close to off stump, all the time in the world to ride the bounce and dab it down gently into the cover point region

short, and Rohit doesn't control the pull but manages to place it in a gap. Gets up near his left shoulder, and he's through his swivel a little early, hits the toe end of his bat and runs away through midwicket
wow, this one is right off the middle of the bat. Only gets up to chest height, and he easily clears the square leg boundary. There is a fielder positioned there, though, so England may not mind
short again, at the hip, swivels to pull to the right of long leg
length ball tossed up outside off, left alone
flighted ball on off stump, presses forward and defends with soft hands. Just lets the ball hit his bat and roll away into the point region

bowled him, Leach has bowled a peach! That's a quick length ball, pitches on off stump stump and straightens to hit the top of off! A bit of inward drift, and Rohit's front pad goes towards the leg side, and not a long way forward, and by the time the ball grips and turns, he's in no position to meet that with his defensive bat
goes back to a quick one spinning from middle to off, defends solidly with the turn
short outside off, and Pujara will put those away all day, rocks back to cut to the right of the diving backward point fielder
tossed up full outside off, presses forward to block it back to Leach
back of a length, angling into the hip, tucks it away, and it's briefly in the air to the left of the diving leg gully fielder
strays onto the pads, clipped to deep forward square leg. Struggling to understand why Anderson has a fielder there for Pujara
back of a length on off stump, blocked back down the pitch, towards mid-off
back of a length, nipping in towards leg stump, punched to short mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to that man at short mid-on again, who's standing right next to the pitch
stays back to a length ball on off stump, defends towards mid-off
a touch short, straightens towards off stump, gets back to block to short cover
full, leg-stumpish, clipped away into the fine leg region
shot. That's a length ball, spinning away from off stump. Not short at all, but he rocks back and punches it to deep point
full, angling in towards Gill's feet, gets forward to block to mid-on
flat length ball angling into leg stump, defended into the on side
quickish length ball close to off stump, spins away and Gill leaves it alone
back of a length, angling into the stumps, defended to midwicket
back of a length, nipping in towards the thigh pad as Pujara looks to flick. Off the thigh pad, and falls short of the man at leg gully. More backward short leg than leg gully, to be accurate
back of a length, angling into leg stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
full, a bit of late swing in towards off stump, shows the full face and plays that to mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs into the point region
full on leg stump, punched to mid-on
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket.
tossed up on middle stump, driven towards mid-off but Leach skips to his left to intercept
flat, angling into the pads, goes back to tuck it watchfully to backward square leg
tossed up outside off, good stride forward to block it back to the bowler
full, angling into middle stump, defended towards midwicket
steps out to this flighted ball on off stump, clips to short midwicket
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump, defended to short midwicket

quickish length ball spinning in towards leg stump, clipped round the corner into the backward square leg region. A bit of extra bounce there, and he did well to meet that with soft hands to keep it down
tossed up outside off, steps out and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning in towards middle stump, goes back in his crease to defend to midwicket
stays back to a fairly full ball spinning in from off stump, defends with the full face towards short leg
Looks to step out but it's too quick for him to get down the pitch. Angled into middle stump, and he presses forward to clip into the leg side

good ball, hangs it in the air, a little slower, angling into off stump. Pujara's bat comes down at a slight angle as he looks to play this into the leg side, and it spins and takes the outside edge, runs away wide of slip
quickish length ball outside off, left alone
sharp turn outside off, and Pujara leaves it alone again. Quick turn too
a touch short on off stump, and he rocks back, makes a bit of room, and punches to short cover
short again, spins away a little wider, jumps back to slap to the right of deep point
goes back to a length ball spinning in quickly towards off stump, blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length, spinning in from slightly wider, goes back and defends back down the pitch
down the track as Bess flights this one higher, just outside off, clips it to short midwicket
flatter, quicker, spinning in towards leg stump, goes back and clips to deep square leg
quickish again, a touch too straight, goes back and flicks through square leg
goes back to one spinning in towards off stump, a bit of extra bounce too, but he deals with it fairly comfortably, lets it hit his defensive bat and roll behind the wicket on the leg side
tossed up on leg stump, Pujara camps back and dinks a single behind square on the leg side
wide of the crease, but Leach drops it short and gives width outside off. Gill is right back, swatting it away with great control to the midwicket boundary
on a length and sides in from around the wicket, ooooh keeps low as Gill meets it, stabbing it to the leg side off the back foot....and the no-ball siren goes off
darted into the leg stump, Gill plays back and wears it on the thigh pad
nice and full, drifts in, Gill gets forward to smother it
drifts in and finds a bit of turn outside off, no shot from Gill
pushed through outside off, Gill stays leg-side of the line, drilling a drive straight to short-cover. This was right in the slot for the drive, but Gill couldn't pick a gap on the off side
floated full on off, Archer is just warming up, played back to him
full and on a fourth-stump line at 131ks, Pujara opens the face and guides the ball to the left of short cover
Archer sharply brings this length ball back into Pujara, blocked solidly on off stump
even fuller and outside off, Pujara dinks it to the left of short cover, and this time he manages to get across to the other end
Archer tests Gill with a bumper outside off, Gill watches it carefully before ducking under it
pitched up outside off, wobbles away further, finishing wider than a set of stumps outside off. Nothing doing from Gill
down the track and driven firmly to Anderson's left at mid-off
looped up on off, blocked off the front foot
sliding in with the arm on middle, Gill plays this non-turner back to Leach
shorter and on off, Gill goes right back to short-arm jab it away to short midwicket
day-five shooter! Darted on off, Gill stoops low to hastily stab that out to the leg side. Leach is bowling much quicker and flatter than he did in the first dig
on a length on off, defended back to the bowler
full and homing away outside off, Gill covers his off stump and lets it go
shorter and holds its line outside off, Gill pushes it in the gap between point and cover
mighty full on off, blocked off the front foot
back of a length and ducking in on middle, Gill camps back and defends resolutely
overpitched and finishes on the pads, picked off to deep midwicket
Archer finds some extra bounce from a length, Pujara rides it and coolly drops it to cover
speared full on middle, 88ks, jabbed to mid-on
slower, tossed up higher on off, forward and smothered by Gill
length-ball slider from around the wicket, whisked away to the leg side off the back foot
flighted and holds its line on off, played back to the left of Leach

Leach ventures wide of the crease, this length ball threatens to drift in, but spins and bounces viciously, beating the outside edge, Buttler, as well as Stokes across diving across to his left from first slip
pushed through on off, defended
short and outside off, patted away to short cover
pretty full and homing in at off, Pujara has a short stride and drives to short cover
mighty full on middle, knuckle-ball variation, squeezed back to Archer off the front foot
lifter from wide of the crease, but angling down leg, as Pujara ducks under it rather easily
fullish and outside off, Pujara has a short stride once again, opening the bat-face and pushing to the left of short cover
Pujara rides the bounce of this shorter delivery outside off and runs it to point in fuss-free fashion
darted flat on leg stump, Gill gets his front leg out of the way and jams it to mid-on
wide of the crease, short and largely holds its line outside off, Gill goes back and punches firmly to the off-side sweeper

Leach nabs Pujara too! On a length, drifts in from wide of the crease towards middle, so Pujara has to play at this. He did well not to jab at it, but the ball turns and bounces sharply to catch the shoulder of the bat and loop to the left of first slip. Superb bowling from Leach, superb catch from Stokes at slip. Massive breakthrough for England on the fifth morning. After being picked apart by Pant in the first innings, Leach is stepping up in the second on his first tour of India
wide of the crease, full and on off, Kohli stretches out to defend
back of a length and sliding in at the top of off, played back to the bowler off the back foot
Kohli is forward to defend this full ball to silly-point
Gill welcomes him with a down-the-track drive to the left of the bowler for four. He steps out, gets closer to the pitch, and puts him away
good length and spins in a wee bit at off, defended
Gill ventures down the track once again, meets a full-toss and drags it away to the left of deep midwicket. The fielder runs across, slides, but Gill finds the fence
down the track and driven down to long-on
tossed up and spins in, Kohli stretches out and drives to short midwicket
tossed outside off, Kohli is right forward to dab it to the covers and get off the mark
pretty full on middle, Kohli stays leg-side of the line and drills it to cover
wide of the crease, on a length and spins away, guided to point off the back foot
darted on middle, defended to the leg side
back of a length and outside off, tip and run to the covers
tossed up on middle, played back to Leach
skidder outside off, no shot
full on off stump, forward and worked away to deep midwicket
looped up outside off, Gill races down the track once again, gets close to the pitch. Unleashes a smooth swing of the bat and clouts it over mid-on
shorter offbreak, Gill jumps back and pulls firmly in the air. Pope at short leg takes evasive action but is seemingly hit on his right pad
driven down to long-on
Kohli goes back to work this length-ball offbreak on off behind square on the leg side
on a length, quicker and spinning into the middle of Gill's defence
eased through extra-cover
flatter and fired on off, tip and run to the left of silly-point
sliding in at off stump, 91.4ks, Gill elects to play back and defends it back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, leans back and forces it to cover-point
tossed up at off, driven to mid-off hanging back
speared into the pads at 89.3ks, clipped to square
Kohli steps out, gets too close to the pitch of this offbreak and drives to short midwicket
full again and outside off, whipped to short midwicket once again
on a length and spins back in at off, Kohli skips back and glances a single through square leg
down the track and punched to long-on
too full and outside off, drilled to Anderson at wide long-on off the front foot
down the track and milked to long-on again, this time by Gill
darted on middle, pushed to mid-on
fired into the pads, and too full, Gill whips it away firmly to the midwicket boundary
wide of the crease, full and dips on middle, pushed to mid-on with a closed bat-face
tossed on middle, worked towards short midwicket off the front foot
wide of the crease, drifts towards middle, like it did to Pujara, but doesn't bounce as much. Carved to backward point
Fourth-innings fifty for Gill! Leach goes wide of the crease, finding turn once again, sliced away to the left of backward point
nice and full, ducking in on middle, Gill is forward to defensively bunt it to short midwicket

wow, what a delivery from Anderson. He storms through the defences of Gill as England push for victory. This is even fuller than the first delivery - perfectly-pitched ball - reverses in to add to the incoming angle from over the wicket, Gill has a rather short stride, Anderson shoots past his inside edge and sends the off stump cartwheeling. Great sight for a fast bowler
full and hung up wide of off, Rahane doesn't bite

Anderson thinks he now has Rahane lbw. Not given by umpire Menon. Root challenges the on-field not-out decision. Another reverse-swinging full ball, bends in at off, Rahane has a short little stride too. But, has he managed to get outside the line? Not bat involved for sure. It would've cannoned into middle, but the tracker returns umpire's call on off stump

No problem for Anderson, next ball he bursts through the defences of Rahane. Full again, Anderson goes wide of the crease and gets this to zip back in. Rahane, like Gill, leaves a bat-pad gap, enough for Anderson to sneak through and topple the off stump. Game-changing stuff from the ageless Anderson. Reverse-swinging shooter. You can't do much against that
full, angling into the stumps, presses forward and pushes towards mid-on
full on leg stump, punched to mid-off
tossed up a bit slower, on leg stump again, defended back to the bowler
flatter, just outside off, good stretch forward to block to silly point
sharp turn from outside off, a bit of flight, left alone
fuller outside off, presses forward and defends with soft hands towards backward point
a touch short, spinning away from off stump, goes deep in his crease to cut towards backward point, who fumbles to allow the single
full, reverses in a touch from outside off, jabbed defensively into the off side
full, a bit of shape in towards off stump, nicely clipped to the right of mid-on
full, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full again, but some width this time, and it's full enough for Pant to go after, creams a drive through cover point
fullish, close to off stump, defended to short cover
length ball angling into off stump, defended into the on side
tossed up on middle and leg, presses forward to defend square on the off side
full, angling into leg stump, clipped away through square leg
tossed up full outside off, pushed into the vacant cover region, and mid-off runs around to stop it
short, wide, slapped to the right of backward point. The man at cover sprints to help out his colleague after he dives and fails to stop the ball
looks for the reverse-sweep out of the rough. Dangerous, especially since he didn't really stretch out a long way. Ends up gloving the ball into his midriff
full outside off, pushed into the vacant cover region once more
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
fuller now, similar line, driven firmly to mid-off
length ball close to off stump, gets back and across to defend into the cover point region
full on off stump, whips it hard but can't beat midwicket diving to his right
length ball outside off, this one leaves him ever so slightly and beats the edge as he has a bit of a poke at it
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
tossed up on middle and leg, driven back down the pitch, towards the bowler, who slows down its progress to mid-off
sharp turn from a middle-stump line, goes right back into his crease and rides the bounce, dabs with soft hands towards backward point. Very well played
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, meets it on the full and drives through point with an open face
tossed up outside off, presses forward and pushes to the right of mid-off
flighted and full on middle stump, nice stretch forward to smother the spin
tossed up on off stump, presses forward and blocks towards silly point
length ball outside off, left alone
ooh, length ball, straightens in the corridor outside off. The line is closer to Pant on this occasion and he looks to defend, playing the angle, and the ball beats his outside edge

gone, Anderson gets his third. A bit of a soft dismissal, but don't discount what the bowler did there. Full, straightening off the pitch on an off-stump line. May have been bowled a bit slower too. Pant looks to play the angle and clip it into the leg side, then realises he can't and tries to adjust, but it's too late, too far in front of his body, and the ball pops up straight to the man at short cover off the leading half of his bat
length ball, fairly wide of off, delivered from around the wicket. Left alone
length ball on middle stump, defended to short cover
length ball close to off stump, defended to cover point
loopy full-toss close to off stump, punched away quietly to the cover boundary
better length on off stump, gets forward and clips watchfully to short leg
short, angling down leg, rocks back, opens up at the hip, and pulls it away to the right of backward square leg. Archer does very well to chase back and pull it in just before it reaches the rope
tossed up full on middle stump, good stride forward to block with the turn

got him, or so England think. Anil Chaudhury is unmoved, and England have reviewed... Quick length ball just outside off, and Washington looks to defend from the crease. Looks like there's a thin edge through to Buttler there... Yup, big spike on Ultra Edge, and Sundar will have to walk back. Really difficult ball to negotiate, that was sharp turn and quick turn
full on leg stump, clipped into the on side
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and defends with an open face to backward point
back of a length close to off stump, opens the bat face and steers it behind square on the off side
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
fullish, wide of off stump, left alone
full, a bit of late reverse in towards middle stump, clipped away through backward square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
goes right back in his crease to work this leg-stump ball through square leg

down the track to this ball floated across towards off stump, meets it on the full and punches to the left of mid-off. Bess doesn't really have the control to bowl without protection in the covers, but in this situation he can have the fielders wherever he wants
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, clipped away to the right of mid-on
goes back to the quick length ball on off stump, not much turn, defended back down the pitch
ooh, steps out again but he isn't to the pitch of this one fired across the stumps. Doesn't turn as expected, and the defensive jab runs into the backward point region off the outer half of the bat
straighter in line, clipped watchfully to midwicket
full, angling into the stumps, clipped to midwicket

fullish, angling into off stump, and the ball stops on Kohli as he gets on the front foot to drive down the pitch. Checks his shot, and the ball loops over the umpire and runs away to the straight boundary
full, angling into leg stump, clipped around his front pad to deep square leg

sharp bouncer to greet Ashwin, who's caught in an awkward position as this one comes in off the pitch, and skiddily at that. Throws his hands up to fend it away, and the ball hits his handle and loops up behind the wicket, but falls well short of the fielder at slip
short once more, rising ball in the corridor, drops his wrists this time and sways his upper body out of the way
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
hit-me full-toss on off stump, and Kohli hits it, clears his front leg and swats it away to the wide long-on boundary
low full-toss this time, on off stump, and Kohli punches it away past the non-striker's left foot
another full-toss, loopier on off stump, and Kohli whips it away between midwicket and mid-on. Shockingly poor over
tossed up on leg stump, gets forward and clips with the turn to short leg
loopy, nearly a full-toss again, at the pads. Gets his front leg out of the way and punches to long-on
short, leg-stumpish, he seemed to be shuffling onto the back foot even before the ball was bowled, anticipating this. Gets what he expected and pulls to deep square leg
bouncer, angling down leg, does well to step across and get away from the line before ducking
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and stabs to point

rising short ball angling into leg stump, and Ashwin's taken another blow. On his right wrist this time, I think. Goes across to try and play it down into the leg side, which he does successfully, but the ball bounces more than expected and smacks him in the wrist

yikes, this is a peppering. Short again, and Ashwin shuffles into line and again the ball climbs awkwardly off the pitch. He's in no position to evade this one, smacks the top of his helmet and ricochets over the keeper
back of a length, angling into leg stump, defended towards short leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to short cover
tossed up on middle stump, Kohli has a short stride and blocks to cover
full and targetting middle stump, Leach bends forward in defence
even fuller on off stump, Kohli backs away slightly and stabs the ball to cover
flatter on middle, blocked on the front foot again
flighted around around off, safely negotiated off the front foot
darted shorter and spins away outside off, Kohli shifts back and punchily plays it to cover
good length and slanting down the leg side, away from the reach of Ashwin's attempted glance
on a length and sliding in at the top of off, Ashwin gets behind the right and blocks to short mid-on
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, blocked off the front foot
short-ball legcutter outside off, barely 120ks, Ashwin sways his upper body out of the way, but does so rather late, copping a blow on his right shoulder
looks like another legcutter, nips away past the outside edge this time
edged again but to the right of slip for four. Full and outside off, swerves away, Ashwin spars at it and gets away. Nobody at second slip to gobble that up
flighted on off, forward and defended to silly-point off the front foot
slightly overpitched on off stump, Kohli gets forward and shovel-drives it with the bottom hand between Leach and Ashwin for four
on a length and drifts back in on off, safely negotiated off the back foot
lobbed up on off, dead-batted away
tossed up invitingly and spins away outside off, Kohli isn't tempted. Left alone
worked off the pads through square leg
short and Anderson brings this back into Ashwin, he stands up tall and punches back to the right of Anderson
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, blocked to short cover
skewed to the right of midwicket off the inner half as Anderson finds reverse-swing
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, ignored
on a length and wobbles away outside off, no shot
on a length and outside off, Kohli gets forward and glides it to point
down the track and clipped away to the right of Burns at short midwicket
wide of the crease, slides in at off, pressed into short cover
wide of the crease, blocked on middle stump
some turn and bounce outside off, ignored
shorter on off, chopped off the back foot to point
flighted on off, no turn this time, Kohli bends forward to dead-bat it away
Anderson now tests Ashwin with a short ball, slanting in towards his shoulder. Ashwin looks away, pulling to the right of midwicket
Kohli presses forward to defend this full ball tailing in at off stump
good length and slanting in at off, blocked to short cover
full and nipping in around middle, Kohli moves forward once again, neatly picking it off through square leg to bring up his half-century
on a length and breaks back in from outside off to run past the inside edge. Shoots low and raises another puff of dust from the Chepauk surface
full and bends in on off, played back to the left of Ande
pushed through on leg stump, Kohli, having backed away, pushes to mid-off
tossed up on middle, defended
wide of the crease, full on off, driven to the left of short cover, where the fielder makes a sprawling save
Kohli reaches out and slices a drive to point
fuller and outside off, Kohli opens the face and runs it away between point and cover
shorter and spins away outside off, chopped straight to point of the back foot
on a length and outside off, Kohli gets closer to the ball and slides it to point
kicks up from a back of a length on middle, stops on Kohli. He checks his shot and spoons this cross-seamer to the right of short midwicket
Kohli closes his bat-face and dabs this length ball from off stump to the right of short midwicket
pitched up and wobbles away outside off, Kohli swishes his bat out of the way and lets it
Kohli rises on top of a short delivery outside off and punches crisply through the line, picking the gap between point and cover
on a length and wobbles away outside off, Kohli opens the face and glides it to point
turn and bounce from wide of the crease, nothing doing from Ashwin
pushed through on off, blocked to cover off the front foot

slides in from wide of the crease, Leach drags his length back as Ashwin uses his feet, strikes the pad. Not given out lbw on the field. Leach has a chat with his captain Root, and England go for a review. Ashwin has his bat jammed behind the pad as he shimmies out, pings the front pad in line with middle. Ball-tracking suggests umpire's call, and it would've bounced over the stumps. Good call from Anil Chaudhary
slow turn for Leach, edged but does not carry to Stokes at slip and sneaks away through his legs
full and flat, jammed to the leg side
shorter and outside off, Kohli rides the bounce and blocks with the spin towards point
on a length and outside off, confidently pushed into the covers
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Ashwin opens the bat-face and punches up to the covers
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, guided squarer to point
full and Stokes probes away outside off, no shot from Ashwin
fullish and homing in at off stump, Ashwin resolutely defends to cover
back of a length and Stokes straightens his line, picked away off middle stump but straight to short midwicket
looped up and finishes on the pads, Kohli replies with a wristy little whip through midwicket
shorter and spins away outside off, the length and slowness of the track allows Ashwin to go back and jab to the covers
tossed up around off, guided square through the off side off the front foot
speared into off stump, safely negotiated off the front foot again
flighted and just a shade outside off, Ashwin opens the bat-face and drives to the left of short cover
skidding through at off, 90ks, hurries Ashwin into a defensive push to point
on a length and wide of off, Kohli shuffles across off, gets closer to it. Punches with a high elbow and sends the ball clattering through the covers
on a length and bending down the leg side, Kohli, having shuffled across off, does not make contact with a flick
full and dips around off stump, cutter from Stokes? Kohli chips it in front of cover off a soft leading edge
full and on a fourth-fifth stump line outside off, Kohli moves forward to pat it to the covers
full and straight, clipped away to deep midwicket
full and skidding in at off stump, Ashwin now shuffles across and manages to keep it out
tossed up outside off, Kohli inches forward, opens the bat-face, and glides the ball past slip

Ashwin was undone by extra bounce in the first innings. The extra bounce gets him in the second too. Fractionally short, drifts in from left-arm around, spins away, and bounces sharply to mess with Ashwin's cut. He can only snick it behind to Buttler who rides the bounce and takes it smartly. After the pasting from Pant in the first innings, Leach now has three wickets. Fine comeback
looped up and dips at off, Nadeem keeps it out
pushed through on middle, defended to the leg side
lobbed up on off, dead-batted away
slider outside off, Nadeem elects to let it go through to Buttler
on a length and outside off, opens the face and glides it square through the off side. Kohli declines the single on offer
dug in short and outside off, but not quite short enough or quick enough. Kohli swivels back and pulls it away with great authority, bisecting the two men in the outfield
Stokes rolls out a cutter, finds extra bounce, defensively dropped towards the covers
full and just a shade outside off, Kohli presses forward, tips it to short cover. No single there
bouncer outside off, Kohli bails out of the hook, and lets it go in the end
Stokes goes wide of the crease, Kohli jumps across off, and plays it straight to point with an open face. No single there as well
quickish spin for Leach, zips past the outside edge as Nadeem hangs his bat out
biiiig bounce for Leach from outside off, Buttler rides it and collects it smartly once again, left alone
looped up on off, Nadeem stretches out to keep it out
chipped in the air but eluding both silly-point and short cover
Nadeem uses his feet again and jabs it in the air to the right of Pope at silly-point. Pope snatches at the ball, but can't touch it. Such a hard chance. These ones stick....or they don't
slider outside off, no shot
on a length and holds its line outside off, Kohli opens the face and deftly glides it past the right of slip. Nobody at third man to cut that off
wide of the crease, bending in at off, Kohli gets forward to defend this full delivery to the covers

It's Stokes' turn to topple the off stump. Reverse-swinging shooter, sneaks under Kohli's bat as he aims to defend. You can't do much against it. Full and bending in from wide of the crease, Kohli brings his bat down and looks to keep it out. No dice. Stokes raises another puff of dust from the Chepauk surface. Okay, replays indicate that it moved off the rough patch and wasn't quite the reverse-swinger
full and wobbles away outside off, ignored
back of a length and slanting in, blocked to the leg side
full at the stumps, Ishant keeps it out
tossed outside off, defended in the air but to the left of Pope at silly-point
wide of the crease, snaking in on middle, Nadeem plays back and blocks wide of Pope

edged and taken, wicket no.4 for Leach! Drifts in towards off stump, which means Nadeem has to play at this. He has a prod at this, the ball turns to graze the outside edge. Buttler can't close his gloves around the ball, loops off the keeper's pad, and Burns at second slip, though, gulps it down
oh hello! Hoicked away to the midwicket fence. Leach tosses it up on middle, Bumrah doesn't meet the pitch, but clouts it away for four
wide of the crease, turn and bounce outside off, beating Bumrah's ambitious slog-sweep. Beats Buttler as well
pushed through outside off, dead-batted away
good length and bending in at off, keeps low, Ishant goes low with it to defend
lifter outside off, Ishant awkwardly fends it off to the leg side. Pops in front of short midwicket and wide of short leg
Archer bangs another one short and outside off, catches Ishant in a tangle, he cops a blow on the ribs
Archer follows the pair of bouncers with an inch-perfect yorker, bends in at middle. Ishant somehow digs it out to the leg side

Archer has pushed Ishant back so much that he has stepped on his own stumps. Hit wicket? The TV umpire has been called in to check. Banged in short at the body, Ishant fends at it off the back foot. Replays indicate that it wasn't Ishant who had stepped back onto his stumps. Strangely, the bails fell even before Archer had delivered. Did the breeze disturb the bails? Deemed a dead-ball
fended in the air to the right of short leg
inside-edged onto the pad
flatter on leg stump, hauled away to the square-leg fence with a slog-sweep
left alone outside off
near yorker, dug out by Ishant
run away to the right of slip
wide of the crease, sliding in on middle, jammed out

Archer has the No.11 nicking off and wraps up a memorable win for England. No fourth-innings five-for for Leach. They win by 227 runs. On a length, threatens to angle it at off, but curves away outside off to square Bumrah up and snag the outside edge. Buttler completes the catch to kickstart the celebrations in the England camp. He will be leaving Chennai with a victory to savour
